title: Seconds to Days Hours Minutes Seconds
description:
The program:

Prompts the user to enter:

Number of days

Number of hours

Number of minutes

Number of seconds

Converts each time unit into seconds:

1 day = 86400 seconds

1 hour = 3600 seconds

1 minute = 60 seconds

Adds them up to calculate the total time in seconds.

Outputs the total seconds.

title: PassKit
description:
PassKit is a modern, macOS-native GUI designed to simplify the process of bypassing Setup.app on legacy iOS devices. Built on top of LukeZGD’s open-source Legacy iOS Kit, PassKit brings a clean, user-friendly interface to a traditionally command-line-based workflow — no Terminal required. Just connect your device, click, and go.

Whether you're restoring an old iPhone, experimenting, or simply want to bring a device back to life, PassKit streamlines the process with features like real-time logging, automatic device detection, and full Dark Mode support. Everything is fully integrated — no external configuration necessary.

PassKit requires macOS 26.0 or later, Python 3, and libimobiledevice. It works best with devices running iOS 9 to 12. For advanced use cases, a jailbroken or rooted device is recommended.

An official installer, portable version, and Homebrew tap are in development. Released under the MIT license, PassKit welcomes contributions, suggestions, and community involvement.

Made with care for tinkerers, enthusiasts, and tech minimalists.

title: Comfort Mode Framework Toolkit
description:
“Beyond Compliance: A User-Autonomy Framework for Inclusive and Customizable Web Accessibility”
Based on: https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2506.10324
This project brings the ideas from this research to life by building a practical toolkit to help developers create more inclusive websites — not just compliant, but comfortable.

It focuses on actionable, plug-and-play tools (like a customizable "Comfort Mode" toggle) that give users real control over their experience — think contrast adjustments, font changes, reduced motion, and more — all while respecting aesthetics and brand identity.

The goal? Make it easy for devs to design with care, adapt to diverse needs, and center user autonomy from the start.

title: ML F1 Tyre Life Prediction
description: This project leverages machine learning techniques to predict Formula 1 tyre life based on historical race data and various car, driver, and session features. By experimenting with different feature engineering strategies—including one-hot and numeric encoding for tyre compounds—and model types such as linear regression, random forests, and gradient boosting, the project aims to optimize tyre strategy decisions. The workflow includes data preprocessing, model training, evaluation with multiple metrics, and analysis of feature importance to support data-driven race strategy in Formula 1.

ZeroWaste Lunchbox is a simple, kid-friendly mobile app designed to reduce lunch waste while making daily meals healthier and more fun.
Built especially for Indian school students, the app suggests balanced lunchbox ideas every day using local food combinations — and lets kids track what they actually eat.

It helps answer:
	•	“What should I pack today?”
	•	“What did I leave unfinished yesterday?”
	•	“How can I waste less food next week?”

The app learns from your habits and makes small changes over time — promoting nutrition, variety, and zero-waste habits, one tiffin at a time!

title: TemporaryGPT
description:
A small tool to make life on ChatGPT more easier. Most of us only use ChatGPT for small quick questions. These are chats we'll never look back to and hence it would be best if ChatGPT never stored them in the first place.

This is why, using the TemporaryGPT userscript, you will be automatically redirected to the temporary chat of ChatGPT.  Just a little add-on but it will also close the sidebar so you that you can focus on your chat.

A great thing about this is that it will only work on the intial load, meaning it won't block you from going to a new chat or other parts of the website.

Decimal to Binary Conversion
Users can input a decimal (base-10) number, and the program converts it to its equivalent binary representation.

title: The Fantastic 3-Bit Binary Counter
description:
Simply this is a 3-Bit binary digit counter that have 3 led to display numbers from 000 to 111
Features:
- Counts from 0 (000) to 7 (111) in binary, covering all 3-bit combinations.
- Three LEDs display the binary output, each representing one bit.
- Easily observe the counter state through the LED indicators.
- Optimized for a small, easy-to-assemble printed circuit board.
- Ideal for learning and demonstrating binary counting and digital electronics basics.
- Uses standard logic Transistors and LEDs for efficient operation.

title: Visionary AI Glasses Software For Visually Impaired Students in Education
description: This software is designed for a pair of smart glasses, using machine learning and a CRNN model to convert text in the user's field of view into audio in real time. It provides a hands-free, accessible reading experience for visually impaired students. While I’ve completed the core software, capable of capturing images, processing text, and generating speech, the hardware integration is part of my future plans. The final device will include a Raspberry Pi, camera module, and other compact components, forming lightweight, wearable glasses. Unlike traditional solutions like braille books or e-pens, this system offers a portable and easy to use solution for students in low-resource environments to access educational content.

title: SHG Management
description:
# SHG Management System

A comprehensive Self-Help Group (SHG) management system built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Prisma.

## Features

- **Group Management**: Create, manage, and oversee multiple self-help groups
- **Member Management**: Track member information, contributions, and loans
- **Financial Tracking**: Monitor group finances, loans, and repayments
- **PDF Import**: Import member data from PDF documents
- **Role-based Access**: Support for admins, group leaders, and members
- **Secure Authentication**: JWT-based authentication with role management
- **Responsive Design**: Works seamlessly on desktop and mobile devices

## Tech Stack

- **Frontend**: Next.js 15, React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS
- **Backend**: Next.js API Routes, Prisma ORM
- **Database**: MongoDB (via Prisma)
- **Authentication**: NextAuth.js
- **File Processing**: PDF-parse, PDFJS-dist
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with dark mode support

title: Locnix AI
description:
Locnix.ai is an AI-powered tool that helps students turn any study material into flashcards instantly. You just paste your class notes, a paragraph, or a topic, and it automatically creates question-answer flashcards that make revision fast and effective. It’s perfect for students preparing for exams, Olympiads, or competitive tests.

How I made it:
I built Locnix.ai using:

Cursor for coding with AI assistance,

Bolt for quickly setting up the website backend and frontend,

Lovable.ai to help shape the idea, UI flow, and branding.

I used no-code and low-code tools in combination with my logic to turn a simple idea into a working site. The flashcards are generated using an AI model that understands user input and breaks it into useful Q&A pairs. The site is clean, fast, and works on any device.

What makes it special:

It's made by a student, for students — simple, fast, and distraction-free.

You don’t need to sign up or download anything — just paste and go.

It uses AI to actually understand the content and generate useful flashcards, not just summaries.

Built transparently using modern tools like Cursor, Bolt, and Lovable, proving that anyone with a vision can build powerful tools today.

title: FarmAI - An AI based project to help farmers.
description:
Inspiration
Growing up, I saw how many farmers in rural areas struggled with unpredictable weather, poor crop yields, and limited access to expert advice. This deeply inspired me to create a solution that could empower them with the right information at the right time. I’ve always been passionate about technology and artificial intelligence, and I wanted to apply these tools to solve real-world problems.

The idea of combining AI with agriculture came from observing how data-driven systems are transforming industries, while agriculture still faces huge gaps in access to information. I realized that even small changes—like recommending the right crop or identifying pests early—could have a big impact on a farmer’s income and food security. That’s what motivated me to build this AI-based platform: to support farmers, reduce resource waste, and make agriculture smarter and more sustainable.

What it does
This project is an AI-powered farming assistant that helps farmers make smart, data-driven decisions to increase productivity and reduce waste. Based on inputs like weather, soil type, pH, NPKC levels, and farm size, it performs the following key functions:

Crop Recommendation: Suggests the most suitable crop using an Artificial Neural Network (ANN), based on soil and environmental conditions.

Irrigation & Water Prediction: Uses ANN to recommend the best irrigation method and estimate the right amount of water needed.

Yield Prediction: Predicts potential crop yield using ANN, helping farmers plan better.

Fertilizer Recommendation: Uses a Random Forest model to recommend the correct type of fertilizer based on nutrient levels and crop type.

Fertilizer & Pesticide Quantity Estimation: An ANN model calculates the exact amount of fertilizer and pesticide needed, avoiding overuse and reducing costs.

The platform uses a Next.js frontend for user interaction and a FastAPI backend to process the inputs and return AI-generated recommendations. It aims to make farming more precise, efficient, and accessible for all.

How we built it
We built this project using a modern and scalable tech stack, combining machine learning models with a full-stack web application.

Frontend: We used Next.js to build a responsive and interactive frontend that allows farmers to input data such as soil type, pH, NPKC levels, weather details, and farm size. The interface is designed to be user-friendly and mobile-compatible for easy access.

Backend: The backend is powered by FastAPI, a fast and efficient Python web framework. It handles incoming requests, processes data, communicates with the machine learning models, and returns predictions to the frontend.

Machine Learning Models:

Crop Recommendation: Built using an Artificial Neural Network (ANN) to analyze environmental and soil parameters.

Irrigation and Water Requirement: An ANN predicts the most suitable irrigation method and how much water the crop will need.

Yield Prediction: Another ANN model estimates the potential yield based on input factors.

Fertilizer Recommendation: A Random Forest classifier determines the best fertilizer based on soil nutrients and crop type.

Fertilizer & Pesticide Quantity: An ANN model calculates precise quantities required to avoid overuse.

Training & Data: We trained our models using agricultural datasets containing soil, weather, and crop data. Each model was evaluated and fine-tuned to improve accuracy and generalization.

All components are integrated seamlessly, ensuring that users get real-time, reliable insights through a web-based interface.

Challenges we ran into
Building this AI-powered farming assistant as a solo developer was a challenging yet rewarding experience. I encountered several obstacles throughout the development process:

Data Collection & Cleaning: Finding accurate, real-world agricultural datasets was difficult. I had to combine multiple sources and spend time cleaning, organizing, and preprocessing the data to make it suitable for model training.

Choosing the Right Models: Selecting the best algorithms for different tasks required experimentation. I tried various models before finalizing ANN for crop prediction, water estimation, and yield prediction, and Random Forest for fertilizer recommendations. Fine-tuning them to get good accuracy without overfitting took time.

Feature Selection: Understanding which input features (like pH, NPKC, farm size, etc.) were most relevant for each prediction task was a major challenge. I had to study agricultural practices and test combinations to get meaningful outputs.

Frontend-Backend Integration: Connecting the Next.js frontend with the FastAPI backend was tricky. I ran into CORS issues and had to carefully manage API routing and request handling to make the data flow smooth and responsive.

Balancing Accuracy & Simplicity: While aiming for high model accuracy, I also had to ensure the system remained simple enough for farmers to use. It was tough to design a system that’s both powerful and practical.

Designing a User-Friendly Interface: I had to make the UI intuitive, clean, and usable even on mobile devices, keeping in mind that many users may not be tech-savvy. Creating a smooth user experience took multiple design iterations.

Working alone pushed me to learn, adapt, and solve problems independently, and this experience helped me grow both technically and personally.

Accomplishments that we're proud of
Built a Complete AI Solution from Scratch: I successfully designed and developed an end-to-end AI system that predicts crops, irrigation needs, fertilizer types, and yield using real agricultural data.

Integrated Full Stack Technologies: I built a fully functional frontend using Next.js and connected it seamlessly to a FastAPI backend, managing both UI design and backend logic on my own.

Trained Multiple ML Models: I implemented and trained multiple machine learning models (ANN and Random Forest) tailored for specific agricultural predictions, achieving good accuracy and real-world usability.

Designed a Clean, Usable Interface: I created a user-friendly web interface that’s responsive and accessible, ensuring ease of use even for farmers with limited technical knowledge.

Learned & Applied Real-World Problem Solving: I tackled real-world issues like data inconsistency, model selection, and feature engineering, and found effective solutions through research and persistence.

Stayed Consistent & Self-Motivated: As a solo developer, I’m proud that I stayed committed, organized, and motivated through each phase—from planning and coding to testing and deployment.

What we learned
Throughout this project, I gained valuable experience and technical skills across multiple areas:

Applied Machine Learning in Agriculture: I learned how to train and evaluate ML models like ANN and Random Forest for real-world agricultural use cases, including crop prediction, yield estimation, and fertilizer recommendations.

Full-Stack Development: I improved my skills in both frontend and backend development using Next.js and FastAPI, learning how to integrate APIs, manage state, and build responsive, user-friendly interfaces.

Data Handling & Preprocessing: I learned the importance of clean, relevant data. I developed skills in data cleaning, normalization, and feature engineering to prepare datasets for model training.

Model Optimization & Evaluation: I gained hands-on experience in tuning hyperparameters, avoiding overfitting, and improving model accuracy and generalization.

Problem-Solving & Debugging: I faced many technical challenges, especially in backend integration and model deployment, which taught me to troubleshoot issues methodically and stay persistent.

User-Centric Thinking: Designing an interface with farmers in mind taught me the value of simplicity and accessibility in tech solutions.

This project gave me the confidence to build practical AI tools and showed me how technology can make a real difference in critical fields like agriculture.

What's next for FarmAI
FarmAI is already live and deployed at farmai-nine.vercel.app(since its backend is hosted on Render's free tier its backend works slow sometimes), providing farmers with AI-powered recommendations. But this is just the beginning. Here's what's next for FarmAI:

Frontend Enhancements & New Features: Continue improving the user interface for a better user experience, adding new functionalities, and optimizing the app for faster loading times.

Multilingual Support: Add support for regional languages to make the platform more accessible to farmers from different areas, especially those in rural regions.

Integration with Real-Time APIs: Incorporate real-time weather and soil data APIs to provide more accurate predictions based on live environmental conditions.

Database Expansion: Add more crop varieties, soil types, and fertilizer profiles to ensure the system caters to a broader set of geographical areas and farming needs.

Once a user selects a desired format, the download process begins on the server, allowing them to safely leave and return later without interrupting the download. Upon completion, a direct download link is generated and shown in the downloads list, enabling seamless transfer to the user's device.

Perfect for anyone looking to build or use a self-hosted solution for managing media downloads via a clean and efficient web interface.

title: Native Notes
description:
A note taking app that has native apps across major platforms (Android, MacOS, and web for the time being) with syncing being the primary feature. 
One thing I've noticed in the note taking apps market is that, if it has multi platform syncing feature then it doesn't feel native to the OS itself or It doesn't have some specific features that I need (for example, locking specific notes with a pin).
For this reason, I am going to make a light-weight app that feels snappy, fully integrated into the platform it's running on (using their native UI frameworks instead of cross platform ones like flutter), and a web UI to quickly access your notes on a different device (Public Library computers for example).

title: 2048: Endgame
description:
*2048: Endgame* - Bash Your Way Through Multipliers, Dividers, and the Forbidden 1!

*Features*
- Play 2048 in your terminal with simple keyboard commands.
- New multiplier feature. (tiles can go x2 or /2)
- This version adds the forbidden 1 (you get it by passing 2 through a "/2" multiplier).
- 3 Difficulty levels:
  - Easy: 6x6 grid, classic normal game.
  - Hard: 4x4 grid, 20% chance each for a "x2" or "/2".
  - Expert: 4x4 grid, 60% chance for "/2", 20% chance for "x2".
- Keeps track of your score.
- No dependencies-just Bash!
- Easy to use and lightweight (literally no dependencies).

Note: Multipliers don't change their position on the board, they just modify the tile going through them.

title: Website and Android App for School After class
description:
Project Name
TechnikTeam - Event & Crew Management System

Elevator Pitch
I replaced my school A/V club's chaotic spreadsheets and group chats with a full-stack web app that manages everything: event scheduling, crew assignments, and a QR-code-powered gear inventory.

Detailed Description
Our school's event tech crew was a mess. To fix it, I built TechnikTeam, a custom web platform that acts as the single source of truth for all our operations. It's a full-stack Java application designed to bring order and professionalism to our student-run events.

🚀 Core Features:

Event Scheduling & Crewing: Plan events, define roles (like "sound tech"), and assign crew members based on their skills.
Live Event Dashboard: During a show, assigned members get a real-time dashboard with a group chat and a shared task list to stay in sync.
QR-Powered Inventory: Catalog all our gear. Anyone can scan a QR code on a piece of equipment to see what it is and where it belongs, and crew members can check items in or out.
Interactive Skills Matrix: A huge grid that visually tracks which crew members are trained on which equipment, making it easy to find the right person for the job.
Role-Based Access: A full admin panel for leaders and a streamlined view for student crew members.
Tech Stack
Java (Servlets/JSP), MySQL, JavaScript, HTML/CSS, Apache Tomcat.

What I Learned
Full-Stack Development: I built the entire system myself, from designing the relational database schema in MySQL to coding the backend logic in Java and building the dynamic frontend with JSP and JavaScript.
Solving a Real Problem: This wasn't a tutorial. I had to talk to my crew, understand their pain points, and design features that actually made their lives easier.
Complex Systems Design: I learned how to architect interconnected features, like making the inventory reservations appear on the event pages and building the complex data queries needed for the interactive skills matrix.

title: Volume
description:
WAV files are a common file format for representing audio. WAV files store audio as a sequence of “samples”: numbers that represent the value of some audio signal at a particular point in time. WAV files begin with a 44-byte “header” that contains information about the file itself, including the size of the file, the number of samples per second, and the size of each sample. After the header, the WAV file contains a sequence of samples, each a single 2-byte (16-bit) integer representing the audio signal at a particular point in time.

Scaling each sample value by a given factor has the effect of changing the volume of the audio. Multiplying each sample value by 2.0, for example, will have the effect of doubling the volume of the origin audio. Multiplying each sample by 0.5, meanwhile, will have the effect of cutting the volume in half.

In a file called volume.c in a folder called volume, write a program to modify the volume of an audio file.


This project is a problem set from Week 4 of CS50x 2025.

title: CampusConnect
description:
CampusConnect - Building Meaningful College Connections

The Challenge:
In today's school and college environment, many students struggle to form genuine connections. Between packed class schedules and the pressure to perform academically, opportunities to meet like-minded peers are often limited. Traditional social platforms aren't designed to facilitate the kinds of friendships that make school and college rewarding.

My Solution:
CampusConnect is a specialized platform designed exclusively for college students to discover meaningful friendships. By focusing on shared academic interests, extracurricular activities and personal values, we help students cut through the noise of generic social networks.

Impact and Vision:
CampusConnect represents a new approach to student socialization - one that values quality connections over quantity. By focusing on the unique aspects of college and school life and the natural connections that exist within academic communities, we're helping students build the kinds of relationships that define the school and college experience.

title: Smartschool MCP
description:
Smartschool MCP is a custom-built MCP (Multi Context Protocol) server that acts as a bridge between Smartschool and AI agents. It connects directly with your Smartschool account, pulls your tasks, tests, and announcements, and makes them accessible via a simple protocol that can be used by AI assistants or other clients. Whether you're building a chatbot, integrating with a voice assistant, or just want an easier way to stay on top of school work, Smartschool MCP makes it effortless to ask, "Do I have any tests this week?" and actually get an answer.

Perfect for students who want to automate their workflow and stop digging through clunky school portals.

Whether it's a cozy sofa, a sleek dining set, or a minimalist work desk, the app brings furniture shopping to life with a visually engaging and intuitive frontend. Backend integration and shopping cart functionality are coming soon!

- Move the menu by dragging it, and it remembers its position.
- Collapse the menu to save space (Alt+T).
- Navigate using keyboard shortcuts (Alt+H, arrows, Enter, etc.).
- See the current section highlighted as they scroll.

title: Decipherinator
description:
Decipherinator is mainly a cipher braking tool for simple and/or classic ciphers.
Using frequency analasys, pattern recognition, and other cryptographical magic this tool will hopefully be able to guess the original plaintext and the recover the original key used for encryption. On top of this the tool will be able to cipher and decipher text with a specific cipher, as well as give information for each one
Decipherinator is Java based, with Gradle to handle dependancies.
--(planned) FEATURES--
-ciphers:
   simple:
    -Caesar Cipher
    -ROT13
    -Atbash Cipher
   medium:
    -Monoalphabetic Substitution Cipher
    -Vigenère Cipher
    -Columnar Transposition Cipher
   complex:
    -Playfair Cipher
    -Autokey Cipher
    -Hill Cipher
   advanced:
    -Enigma-like Rotor Machine Ciphers
    -One-Time Pad (if key reused)
-code breaking for each cipher
-encryption with each cipher
-a lerning section with tutorials and explanations of how each cipher works and how to crack them
-a simple GUI with swing to improve UX

Shipkit is an open-source, self-hosted Platform-as-a-Service that makes it dead-simple to run any Docker-based app on your own server. Think of it as a modern, community-driven alternative to Coolify, CapRover or Dockploy—rebuilt from scratch with today’s tech so it’s faster to extend and easier to maintain.

Example:
Paste a Docker-Compose file, click “Deploy”, and your app is online.
A clean web dashboard to start, stop and monitor all your services.
Built-in user accounts so you can safely share the platform with teammates.
100 % open source and cloud-agnostic—run it anywhere Docker runs.

Multiple puzzle types inspired by real-world cybersecurity concepts

Level-based progression with increasing complexity

Immersive sound effects and retro-style UI

🔐 Can you survive the breach, or will the system shut you down?

title: Compapet
description:
/\/\      /\/\
( o.o )  ( o.o )
 > ^ <    > ^ <
PURR!  WOOF!

✨ Unleash Your Inner Pet Parent! ✨

Tired of lonely desktops? Craving a bit of animated companionship? Say hello to your very own Desk Pet Companion! This delightful Python-powered application brings an adorable animated cat 🐱 (or dog 🐶!) right to your screen, ready to wander, play, and chill by your side.

🌟 What's Inside This Pawsome Project? 🌟

Dynamic Duo: Choose your companion! Instantly switch between a charming Cat 🐱 or a loyal Dog 🐶 right from your system tray menu!

Life-like Animations: Watch as your pet cycles through various animated states:

🐾 Walk: Leisurely strolls across your screen.

🏃‍♀️ Run: Zips from one edge to another with purpose!

😴 Idle: Takes a well-deserved break, looking cute as ever.

... and more!

Interactive Fun:

👆 Drag & Drop: Grab your pet with your mouse and place them anywhere on your screen!

🖥️ Smart Wandering: Your companion intelligently navigates your desktop, bouncing off edges and choosing new paths.

Stealth Mode (System Tray Integration):

Minimize clutter! Your pet can run quietly in the background, accessible from your system tray.

Right-click the tray icon to quickly Show/Hide your pet, or change their species!

Keep it running as long as you like, or safely Exit from the tray menu.

🛠️ The Magic Behind the Whiskers (and Wags!) 🛠️

Built with Python and the robust PyQt5 framework, this project seamlessly integrates into your desktop environment. It handles sprite animation, fluid movement calculations, and smooth user interactions, all while living discreetly in your system tray.

    _      _       _        _
  ( ` )  ( ` )    ( ` )   ( ` )
(___)(___)(___)(___)
  P A W       P R I N T S 

Get ready for some digital cuddles! Run the app and let the companionship begin! 🚀

Powered by speech-to-text models and an emotion-aware LLM, the avatar responds naturally with animated facial expressions and social cues.

Designed for use in elementary and middle school classrooms, **ExpressBuddy** supports special education, ESL, and social-emotional learning (SEL) goals.

description:
NepLoom is an ed-tech social blogging platform where creators, known as NepLers, post interactive and gamified blogs called Looms. These include quizzes, flashcards, streaks, and more, making learning enjoyable and engaging.

It supports articles, microblogs, documents, and even custom code. Built-in tools like text-to-speech, note-taking, AI summaries, and translation help users learn more effectively.

Creators earn money through ads and promotions. Readers can choose to earn by viewing ads as Space Loomers or skip them as Time Loomers. Revenue is shared fairly: 40/40/20.

NepLoom is not just a platform; it’s a vision to make education free, fun, and accessible to everyone.

title: VibeIQ
description:
VibeIQ is a vibrant, gamified learning app designed to transform studying from a chore into an engaging adventure. Built with high school and AP students in mind, it blends education with playful competition, making it easier to stay motivated while mastering challenging subjects.  

Imagine an app that feels more like a game than homework—where you earn XP for every correct answer, maintain daily streaks to unlock rewards, and compete with friends on lively leaderboards. VibeIQ offers structured courses across subjects like biology, math, and literature, each broken into bite-sized quizzes with instant feedback. Miss a question? No problem—the app explains the solution so you learn as you go.  

Beyond academics, VibeIQ keeps things fun with customizable avatars, collectible badges, and a virtual shop where you can spend gems on power-ups or cosmetic upgrades. Whether you're prepping for exams or just reinforcing classroom lessons, VibeIQ turns study sessions into something you’ll actually look forward to. It’s education, but with the excitement of your favorite mobile game.

title: command_line_RPG
description:
🖥️ command_line_RPG: The Real-World Adventure Terminal
Genre: Command Line Interface (CLI) Simulation RPG
Platforms: PC / Terminal / GitHub
Main Themes: Real-life data, Crypto (Monero), Renewable Energy, Rocket Simulation, Astronomy
Estimated Playtime: ~100 hours

🌐 What is command_line_RPG?
command_line_RPG is a reality-linked RPG that transforms your real-world knowledge, actions, and experiments into a poetic, technical journey.
Using the command line, you mine crypto, observe stars, simulate rocket engines, and build renewable energy systems — all while progressing through a richly crafted storyline.

This is a fusion of science, engineering, and self-exploration, disguised as a retro-futuristic terminal game.

🎮 Key Features
⚙️ Mining Missions: Use real Monero mining data to unlock story and progress.

🔭 Astronomy Quests: Log real observations of planets, galaxies, and lunar phases.

🚀 Rocket Engineering Simulations: Perform CEA-based engine calculations and optimize performance.

🔋 Power Generation Projects: Track your own solar, wind, or hydro energy outputs and improve their efficiency.

🧾 Reality-Based Progression: All gameplay is based on your actual logs, experiments, and learning records.

🗂️ Mission Structure
Main Missions: Large-scale achievements or scientific goals (e.g. build your first hybrid power system).

Side Missions: Daily tasks linked to energy use, learning, or stargazing.

Titles: Earn unique poetic/technical titles like “Hashrate Seeker” or “Photon Cartographer”.

💰 Currency System
Game currency is Monero (XMR).

Used symbolically to reflect mining efforts; no in-game shop or artificial economy.

All progress is non-commercial, learning-focused, and privacy-respecting.

🧑‍🚀 Player Profile
You are the protagonist. Your real-world progress shapes your storyline.
From tinkering with Raspberry Pi-powered devices to late-night star logs — your reality becomes the plot.

📌 Why play?
To learn by doing.

To gamify everyday experiments.

To document your own technical evolution.

To turn a terminal into a storytelling device.

📁 A game you don’t just play — you live it.

title: http://prashath.me – My Personal Developer Portfolio
description:
fully responsive and professionally designed personal portfolio website that highlights my journey as a full-stack web developer. It serves as my digital identity—showcasing my skills, projects, and achievements in a visually appealing and technically sound manner.

🚀 Key Features:
💻 Tech Stack:

Frontend: React.js (component-based structure)

Styling: Tailwind CSS (utility-first, modern responsive design)

Scripting: JavaScript (dynamic behavior and interaction)

Responsive Design: Fully optimized for mobile, tablet, and desktop

Version Control: Git & GitHub

Deployment: Hosted on a secure domain – prashath.me

📂 What It Includes:

Introduction section with animation and engaging UI

Skills section with icons and tech stack cards

Projects Gallery with live links and source code

Resume Download and About Me sections

Contact Form connected with email integration

Smooth scroll, hover animations, and dark/light theme 

🧠 Design Principles:

Minimalistic, fast-loading, and user-friendly interface

Semantic HTML and accessibility-first approach

Mobile-first responsive layout using Tailwind breakpoints

🎯 Purpose:
To create a strong personal brand and showcase my technical and design capabilities in real-time. This project reflects my understanding of building modern, production-ready websites from scratch using React and Tailwind CSS, with a focus on both frontend performance and user experience.

title: true feeback
description:
True Feedback 🔍💬
Anonymous feedback, real insights.
True Feedback is a web application that allows users to receive honest, anonymous feedback through a unique shareable link. Users can track basic analytics, including commenter location, device type, and engagement trends.
Features
- 🚀 Anonymous Feedback – Users can share a unique link and receive genuine opinions without revealing commenter identities.
- 📊 Analytics Dashboard – Get basic insights on where feedback comes from, device types, and engagement patterns.
- 🔒 Secure & Private – Feedback remains anonymous, and data is stored securely using MongoDB and Express.js.
- 🎨 Intuitive UI – Built with Tailwind CSS for a seamless and modern user experience.
- ✉️ Easy Sharing – Share your feedback link on social media and other platforms effortlessly.
Tech Stack
- Backend: Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB, Mongoose
- Frontend: React.js, Tailwind CSS

title: Cloud VM Monitoring
description: The objective of this project is to evaluate a virtual machine's (VM) ability to support specific workloads by generating controlled traffic that allows its performance to be measured in real time. To achieve this, a monitoring system will be implemented that collects key metrics such as CPU usage, RAM consumption, and active kernel processes. Load and performance tests will be performed using tools such as Locust, and the infrastructure will be deployed on Kubernetes, leveraging cloud services such as Cloud SQL and Cloud Run to ensure scalability and availability.

title: MoodAtlas – Interactive Emotion Mapping App
description: MoodAtlas is a local web application that helps users track and visualize their emotions through an interactive map. Each day, the user writes a short text about how they feel. A local AI model analyzes the emotional content and places it on a dynamic "emotion map" – a visual representation of mental states over time. The app is fully offline and prioritizes privacy. It is built using React (frontend), FastAPI (backend), and MariaDB (database). The goal is to support emotional self-awareness and pattern recognition without compromising personal data.

Recollekt is user friendly and allows anyone you share the album with to add images so that you don't have to go dming every person. title: Minecraft_Mods-Gen
description:
A smart Minecraft modpack generator that:

Prompts the user for Minecraft version, modloader (e.g., Forge, Fabric), and modpack theme (e.g., PvP, Magic, Tech, Lifesteal).

Uses Google Gemini API to generate relevant and high-quality mods based on the input context.

Cross-checks each suggested mod using the Modrinth API to:

Ensure availability

Match the Minecraft version and modloader

Exports the list to a gen-mods.txt with mod slugs (compatible with Ferium for easy downloading).

Automatically filters out unavailable, incompatible, or duplicate mods for a clean, install-ready modpack.

title: Achernar
description:
Achernar is a modular, AI-powered astronomy platform designed for real-time imaging, smart guidance, and field reliability—running entirely offline if needed. At its core is the Achernar Daemon, a headless service written in Rust and C++ that runs on edge devices like Raspberry Pi, Jetson, or field laptops. This daemon handles camera interfacing (via V4L2 or ASI SDK), real-time frame capture, debayering, and hardware encoding, with integrated ONNX Runtime or TensorRT for on-device inference. It runs a local REST API (via actix-web or warp) to expose control interfaces.

The AI layer performs offline inference to suggest focus, exposure, and filter settings based on local environmental conditions, using quantized ONNX models that are confidence-based and never enforced. Imaging sessions are organized in a local-first folder structure, saving FITS files, logs, and preview videos, with append-only JSON logs and optional SQLite used for dashboard caching. When internet becomes available, sessions can be automatically synced to S3, Google Drive, or Dropbox via rclone or custom Rust logic.

Users interact through either a WebApp PWA, designed with React or SvelteKit + Tailwind CSS, or a Desktop App for advanced control. The WebApp is served from the edge device over a local Wi-Fi hotspot, enabling users to preview live streams (MJPEG or WebRTC), pick targets, and start imaging directly from their phone or tablet. The Desktop App—built using Qt or Tauri—caters to professionals with tools for FITS inspection, focus metric plotting, and full mount control (via INDI or ASCOM). All user sessions are secure, crash-safe, and never rely on cloud services for imaging, making Achernar robust for remote or off-grid astronomy. Cloud sync and remote dashboards activate only post-session, ensuring reliability with WebSockets for control and WebRTC tunnels for live previews, hosted optionally via Next.js or SvelteKit on platforms like Vercel.

title: A-Maze: Create, Play and Share mazes!
description:
A-Maze is a maze game where you can generate, play and share mazes online for free. It is built using HTML, CSS, and vanilla JavaScript. The game allows you to create mazes of different sizes and difficulty levels, and you can also play mazes created by other users. The game features a simple and intuitive interface, making it easy to navigate and play.

There are three difficulty levels: Easy, Medium, and Hard. The game also includes a timer to track your progress. Upon completing a maze, you will receive a score based on how difficult the maze is and how accurate your moves are. The score does not depend on the time taken though.

A maze collection is integrated into the game. So, you can choose any maze of your choice to play. You can also choose to generate a random maze locally on your machine instead. You can share either of these mazes with your friends by clicking "Share Maze" on the game play screen.

If you can't solve a maze, you can click "Reveal Answer" and view the solution.

AI used for code completion (GitHub Copilot)
More features like custom maze crafting will be added soon!

title: MD 2 HTML
description:
A JS script to automatically fetch your GitHub project README and convert it into HTML. I made this in hopes to contribute to summer of making, since they are also planning to build this thing.

A special feature of this is the URL parsing. The script is equipped with an automatic URL editor that converts all of your relative URLS into absolute ones.

Basically, if you want to make a portfolio website, all you have to do for each project page is to input your raw README URL and....that was actually it. Your Completely empty HTML page will become an exact replica of your README.

Of course you can always choose where it places the README so that your navbar and footer or other elements remain safe, and you can also apply custom CSS or any other styles.

Therefore, I wanted to make my own combat behavior that hopefully solves these issues.

title: Drift Agro 4.0
description:
My project is a modular MLOps pipeline built in Python to detect data drift in production environments. It runs automatically (e.g., daily via Airflow), compares live data against a reference dataset using tools like evidently and alibi-detect, and generates both human-readable reports and machine-readable metrics.

What makes it special is its full automation and traceability: it not only detects drift but also logs key metrics, triggers alerts via Slack or email, and can even launch retraining pipelines. Each run produces decision artifacts—JSON outputs, HTML reports, and CSV logs—making the system both auditable and actionable.

title: RealTime
description:
We all have that friend with whom we spend our evenings chatting.
We all know what it feels like to stare at the words "is typing" under the name of the person we're talking to.
Have you ever thought "I wonder what he's typing" or "what a waste of time, if we were meeting in person or talking on the phone, everything would be faster"?
The goal of RealTime is exactly this: see what is being written character by character: you can almost double thespeed of communication! We are developing RT server, protocol and android client.

RT android app wants to go beyond this and make you feel in front
of your interlocutor. Thanks to its human-centered design, animations and its "organic interface". RealTime doesn’t aim to replace existing and widely
used messaging systems but rather to be an extension to them.

Features:
1. Real-time typing
2. Live voice messages
3. Live images
4. Physical proximity for contact
5. E2E encryption
6. Export JSON and nice PDF
7. Open source and well documented

title: Fox Thoughts
description:
Fox Vents is a minimalist, anonymous web app for private venting — built as a digital space where I (Fox) can drop thoughts, feelings, or memories without judgment.

It’s made using Next.js (App Router) + React + shadcnui + TailwindCSS, with Firebase for data and Cloudinary for media uploads. The viewer site is public and read-only, while the dashboard is protected and made just for me.

What makes it special is the intention — it’s not for likes, follows, or comments. It’s just crumbs. Quietly placed. Safely kept.

title: Movie Rating System
description:
The movie rating system is a software application designed to allow users to view, rate, and review movies. Users can register and log in to access features such as submitting ratings (typically on a scale, e.g., 1 to 5 stars) and writing text reviews for movies they have watched. The system stores user ratings and calculates an average rating for each movie, which is displayed alongside the movie’s details.

Administrators can manage movie data, including adding, updating, or deleting movie entries. The system ensures that each user can rate a movie only once, but they can update their rating if needed. It may also include search and filter options to help users find movies by genre, release year, or rating. The main goal is to provide an organized way for users to share feedback and for others to discover well-rated content.

title: Unit Converter (Length)
description: This is a beginner-friendly Java console application that performs basic length unit conversions. Users can convert values between meters, kilometers, feet, and inches. The program presents a simple text-based menu for selecting the conversion type. After the user inputs their choice and a numeric value, the app calculates and shows the result. Conversions are precise and displayed with four-decimal accuracy. The logic uses a switch-case structure and basic math. Input is handled using the Scanner class for interactive use. Formatted output ensures clarity of results. It is lightweight, fast, and easy to understand. This project is perfect as a starting utility or open-source snippet.

title: study-buddy study tracker app
description: The Study Tracker App is a full-stack web application built using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB. It is designed to help students organize their daily study schedule, stay motivated, and monitor their academic progress in a structured way. Users can add study tasks by subject, set estimated study durations, and mark tasks as completed. The app visually displays progress through interactive charts, making it easy to track the time spent on different subjects over days or weeks. An optional Pomodoro timer is also included to encourage focused study sessions. All user data is securely stored in MongoDB, allowing for persistent tracking across sessions. This project is ideal for students preparing for exams, learners building daily study habits, and anyone looking to improve their time management and productivity.

title: Tile mapper
description:
Motivation:
To enable localization of an Autonomous Underwater Vehicle (AUV) by detecting tiles and estimating its pose from camera frames.

Project Overview:
This project focuses on developing an initial script that processes video frames of a tiled swimming pool floor. By detecting the grid of tiles, the system aims to compute the camera’s (AUV’s) rotation and translation in 3D space—laying the foundation for visual localization underwater.

title: Just Thanks Exchange
description:
JTExchange (aka Just Thanks Exchange, JTEx) is a cool, digital P2P conduct-points system that turns every kind act into tradeable campus credit—send points to friends, stack points for perks, or just flex on the leaderboard.

GPT says "A lot of U.S. schools use PBIS—point-based rewards for positive behavior (aka conduct points)"
—so we’ve simply taken that idea online and turned it into a peer-to-peer system.
Imagine when Rankings, XPs, Levels, and rewards appear in this points system. It’s not teachers scoring you, it’s friends recognizing you.

Features:
- Natural-language trading (thanks to LLMs)
- LLM-powered history summaries
- Campus posts (even with voting)

Tech Stack:
- Frontend: Vue 3 + Ant Design
- Backend: JavaScript + Express
- DB Compatibility: support Vercel SQL, DetaBase, or any sequelize.js supported database (including PostgreSQL)
- Deployment: My homeserver + Cloudflare

Notice:
- There are some things that have not been i8n yet
- Demo Links cannot reflect the latest program (a more stable version will be deployed)

简中介绍：
JTExchange（又名 Just Thanks Exchange，JTEx）是一个数字 P2P 操行分系统，它把学校里的“操行分”变成了可交易的、数字化的。你可以把它转给朋友、或者只是在排行榜上炫耀。
排行榜、经验、等级、奖励……不再让老师给你无理由地扣分，而让同学们自治！

特色：
- 自然语言交易（得益于 LLM）
- 历史交易摘要
- 校园帖子系统（还能投票的那种）

技术堆：
- 前端：Vue 3 + Ant Design
- 后端：JavaScript + Express
- 数据库兼容：支持 Vercel SQL，DetaBase 或者任何 sequelize.js 所支持的（包括 PostgreSQL）
- 部署：家里云+Cloudflare

注意：
 - 这个项目有一些还未国际化的地方
 - 演示链接不能反应最新的程序（一个较稳定的版本才会被部署）

title: ESP32 WireGuard mesh networking project
description:
A ESP32-based networking project that uses a low-cost microcontroller to create a VPN mesh network.
We can implement a standalone WireGuard VPN server using the ESP32, allowing global internet sharing using DuckDNS integration.

Personally, in my locale, I feel I don't need to recharge my cellular and home Wi-Fi at the same time,
so I can instead use this project.

Its key innovations include:
• Autonomous mesh network formation with multi-client VPN server supporting 10 device connections
• Good for battery-optimised performance
• Management dashboard made with Flutter and React for web and smartphone support
• It eliminates the traditional limitation of ESP32 VPN implementation by combining WireGuard and ESP32 mesh protocol — hence we can achieve a 15+ Mbps internet connection throughput using it, while having low power consumption

Applications:
• Personal internet sharing
• Enterprise remote access
• Emergency communication
• IoT fleet management

title: BiasLens - Reveal Hidden Bias
description:
BiasLens will be an open-source tool that analyzes bias in language, from stereotypes to harmful social narratives. It will extract data from articles, posts, and everyday comments.

🧠 What's is in my mind?
1. I want a tool that could automatically scrapes text from the web (Twitter, Reddit, news, etc.)

2. Use NLP to detect bias using AI and custom logic

3. Understands stance, tone, and intent. The tool should be able to analyze sentiment and opinion on the topic/ bias.

4. Outputs clean, structured data for research and advocacy

5. Grading or classification system.

🎯 My Focused Areas:

Although intended to be extendable and used in various fields and topics. I first want to use it one Gender stereotype/ bias since I myself suffered from it.

📦 Built for:

Researchers & students

Activists & journalists

Developers exploring social impact

title: Multi-Region Disaster Recovery
description:
This project, which originated from my university studies, is now a complete, automated disaster recovery system for AWS.

Using Terraform, I built a multi-region infrastructure with a primary EC2 instance and a backup instance in a separate region. The system automatically detects when the primary instance fails using CloudWatch Alarms. This triggers a notification via SNS and SQS, which a Python script on my home server receives. The script then instantly starts the backup EC2 instance to take over.

To monitor the system, I also developed a web dashboard using React and Flask that shows the real-time status and metrics of both instances.

title: FreeIdeas
description:
Free Ideas is a site where you can publish your ideas for projects, apps, and websites, and where you can find inspiration for your next project.
You can search for ideas, publish your own ideas, ask for help on your ideas, or just browse through the ideas of others.
The published ideas are free to use, and you can use them as you wish, without any restrictions (except for the ones mentioned in the license).
The site is open to everyone, and you can contribute by publishing your own ideas or by helping others with their ideas.
The goal of Free Ideas is to create a community of people who share their ideas and help each other to bring them to life.
If you have an idea that you want to share with the world, or if you are looking for inspiration for your next project, Free Ideas is the place for you.

title: BloatOS
description: Despite the name, BloatOS is the complete opposite of bloat. It’s a minimalist operating system built from scratch — starting with a custom bootloader written in pure C (with just enough assembly to boot). The project includes my own memory map, screen output, kernel loading, and hardware interaction — no GRUB, no external frameworks, no Linux kernel. My goal is to understand how real operating systems work under the hood by building one myself, as lean as possible.

title: Ideology Tracker
description:
Enter a phrase and you'll see the closest matching political ideology

This is mostly a test as my first real project in Python--or any programming language for that matter. It simply keeps track of terms in a given phrase and returns a matching ideology based on the amount and kind of terms used in the phrase. It has no UI, it doesn't handle ties, and only recognizes words and not their context, so if you type in "I don't care about the workers and I dislike the idea of public ownership", it'll return the matching ideology as socialism.

title: Whatsapp
description:
This project is a full-featured clone of WhatsApp, built from scratch using modern Android development tools. It replicates core functionalities of WhatsApp including real-time messaging, chat UI, contact syncing, and media sharing — delivering a smooth and familiar user experience.

💡 Key Features:

🔐 End-to-End Chat Encryption (optional with libs)

💬 1-on-1 Real-Time Messaging (Text, Emojis)

👥 Group Chats

📱 Contact Syncing

🟢 Online/Offline Presence

🔔 Push Notifications with FCM

🎨 UI Cloned to Match WhatsApp Feel (Jetpack Compose or XML)

🛠️ Tech Stack:

Kotlin + Jetpack Compose 

Firebase (Auth, Firestore, Storage, FCM) 

MVVM Architecture

Coroutines & Flow for async operations

title: 🔋 WattUp – A Better Way to Track Your Battery
description:
Let’s be honest—the default battery stats in Windows are pretty useless. You get a percentage and maybe a rough time estimate if you're lucky. That’s where WattUp comes in.

WattUp is a simple but powerful app that gives you actual insight into your laptop's battery. Whether you’re trying to figure out why your battery drains so fast or just want better info while charging, WattUp has your back.
Here’s what it can do:

    Track battery usage over time with clean, interactive graphs

    Show your battery health, including wear level and original vs current capacity

    Give you charging and discharging estimates based on real usage, not guesswork

    Show detailed battery stats like cycle count, voltage, temperature, and more

    Run quietly in the background without eating up your system resources

It’s everything the Windows battery meter should’ve been, but isn’t.

If you care about your battery and want better control over how your device uses power, WattUp makes it easy.

title: EDULates
description:
EDULates is an AI-powered web platform designed to enhance and personalize the process of learning new languages. Built with Django and integrated with open-source language models, EDULates offers an intelligent, interactive, and user-friendly environment where students can improve their grammar, vocabulary, translation skills, and conversational fluency.

Leveraging powerful open-source NLP models (such as T5, Gramformer, and Helsinki-NLP), EDULates enables learners to:

📝 Receive real-time grammar and spelling corrections with explanations

🌍 Translate sentences intelligently between languages with contextual understanding

💬 Engage in realistic conversations with an AI-powered language partner

🎯 Practice through customized exercises and receive adaptive feedback based on performance

Whether you're a beginner or an advanced learner, EDULates adapts to your level and learning style, providing instant guidance and personalized suggestions. It is designed to make language learning more dynamic, effective, and accessible — all powered by free and open-source AI models.

title: Rust QOI implementation with Python bindings
description:
The "Quite OK Image Format" (https://qoiformat.org/) is a lossless image compression format that compresses images to a similar size of PNG, while offering 20x-50x faster encoding and 3x-4x speedier decoding.

I heard about it in a video talking about how PNGs work (https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=EFUYNoFRHQI) and found it interesting and it's specification fits on one A4 page, so I decided to implement my version of it in Rust (learning Rust the process) and creating Python bindings for it as python is my primary programming language. This will be a challenge, but I am down for it (-:

title: Vidminal
description:
📺 Vidminal: Terminal Video as ASCII Art

--- WHAT IS THIS THING, ANYWAY?! ---
🤔 ► Ever wished you could watch videos... in your terminal? 🤯
🤨 ► NO? Well, I DON'T CARE, HERE IT IS. 🤷‍♀️
👀 ► You've seen ASCII art demos. You've seen those looping gifs. Cute. 😏 This ain't that.
✨ ► Vidminal takes [ANY] video file you throw at it—your favorite anime clip 🎬, a movie 🍿, that weird cat video from 2009 😼—and turns it into a live, colorful, animated ASCII art spectacle right in your terminal.
🎶 ► And it's not just a silent movie. We've got synchronized audio. 🔊 We've got full controls. 🎮 This isn't a toy; it's a legit, if slightly unhinged, [TERMINAL MEDIA PLAYER]. 🚀

---

--- HOW'D I MAKE IT HAPPEN? ---
🐍 ► It's a Python party! 🎉
💪 ► I wrangled some of Python's coolest libraries to pull this off:
🎬 ► `moviepy` & `ffmpeg`: To rip the video and audio apart. ✂️
🖼️ ► `Pillow`: For the pixel-to-text magic. ✍️
🔈 ► `pygame`: To blast the sound waves at your ears. 🎧
🎨 ► `colorama`: To paint everything in glorious 24-bit color. 🌈
⚡ ► `threading`: To make sure the controls work while the video is playing, because nobody likes a laggy player.
🗺️ ► It was a journey fueled by caffeine ☕ and a questionable sense of purpose. 🌀

---

--- WHY IS IT AWESOME? ---
🌟 ► It's pure, unfiltered, terminal power! ✨
🕹️ ► TOTAL CONTROL: You get a full-fledged player experience. Pause, play, quit, rewind, and fast-forward. Adjust the volume. Mute the chaos. It's all there. ⏯️🎚️
📦 ► ZERO SETUP: Download the release for your OS and just... run it. 🚀 I bundled `ffmpeg` so you don't have to install a single thing. I did the boring work for you. You're welcome. 🙏
✅ ► THE BEST PART: YOU ARE THE ARTIST! 🎨 Don't like the default look? Open `options.json` and:
✍️ ► [CHANGE THE CHARACTERS!] Use `█▓▒░` for a blocky look, or a detailed set like `$@B%8&...`, or even make your own `custom` set! You control the texture of your video! 字符✨
🎛️ ► [TWEAK THE VISUALS!] Adjust `gamma` and `contrast` to get that perfect moody, cyberpunk, or over-saturated look. ⚙️📊
🤯 ► Prepare for your friends to look over your shoulder and go, "WTF?! Is that... a movie... in your terminal?" 😲
👍 ► Yes. Yes it is. 😎

title: Typing Speed Test
description:
Typing Speed Test is a feature-rich, multi-language web app designed to help users improve their typing skills in a fun and interactive way. Built with HTML, CSS, and vanilla JavaScript, it features a clean, responsive design that works seamlessly on desktop and mobile.

Features:
Multi-Language Support: English, Arabic, French, and Spanish — with full UI translation.

Game Modes: Full Passage, Timed (15s–120s), Word Count (10–100), and Custom Text.

Live Feedback: Real-time WPM, accuracy, and error tracking.

Advanced Options: Toggle punctuation, enable Sudden Death mode, and filter passage length.

User-Friendly: Distraction-free interface, mobile-optimized, no sign-up or install needed.

Just choose your language and mode — and start typing!

title: ImposterGame with AI
description:
Hello everyone o/
Here in Germany, at the moment, the Impostor game is a really huge trend.

In short: The Impostor game is a game where you and your friends get together. Everyone receives a secret word except for the Impostor. Now, everyone has to say a word. The crewmates have to say a word which tells the other crewmates that they themselves are not the Impostor, and the Impostor tries to mislead them into thinking that person isn't the Impostor. After a few rounds, everyone votes for one player they think is the Impostor. If they get it right, they win; if not, the Impostor wins.

Example: The word is beach

Crewmate1 says: Cocktail (because of beach bar and such things)
Crewmate2 says: Castle (because of building a sandcastle)
Impostor1 says: Sun ( because the Imposter understood that the word may be sth about vacation/beach or sth like that)

Currently, many students, like myself, are playing at school in free time and, for example, in breaks.

There are many apps being used, but I thought about the people who don't have many friends to play with because there maybe want to play the game too but cant ( xD )  . That's why I want to work on an app where you can play it yourself with AI friends.

I know it sounds like a troll project, and yeah, it was a random thought I had at school, but I kind of liked it. That's why I am programming it.

My goal is to make an Android & iOS compatible app where you can just play the Impostor game with a few AI Agents.

I also chose this project because normally I mainly write Python or Java backend code, and I want to challenge myself to program some React Native.

title: MindPilot
description:
MindPilot is an AI-powered productivity and learning assistant designed to help users stay focused and understand any topic more effectively.
As a technical high school student preparing for final exams, I often face two major problems: it's hard to stay concentrated for long periods, and it's even harder to understand difficult topics quickly and deeply. MindPilot was born from this personal frustration, a tool that combines a smart focus assistant with an intelligent tutor, all in a lightweight and accessible web app.

MindPilot allows you to start distraction-free focus sessions using a timer-based system while keeping track of your progress. But what makes it unique is the ability to ask any question or type any topic, and the built-in AI (powered by Cohere’s Command R+ model) explains it in a clear and understandable way. Whether you're struggling with a math concept, a programming topic, or even a piece of history, MindPilot is here to help.

The project is built using React for the frontend and FastAPI for the backend. It connects to the Cohere API to generate explanations in real time. A .env system is used to keep API keys safe, and the frontend and backend communicate through REST endpoints.

Throughout the Summer of Making, I plan to extend MindPilot with new features such as:

A personal progress dashboard
Support for multiple subjects and languages
Enhanced session analytics
And eventually, a mobile app version
The goal is to turn MindPilot into something that doesn't just help me but could help any student, self-learner, or curious mind around the world. It’s more than a study tool. It’s a digital co-pilot for your brain.

title: [WH] Working Healthily 工位天使
description:
It's a pretty cool system that uses CV (specifically YOLO) and LLMs to keep an eye on desk jockey health in the office. It's like a real-world "screen time tracker"!

It basically monitors your posture, how much you're moving around, and even your water intake. The idea is to give you real-time health feedback and suggestions right when you need them.

Backend: Vue+FastAPI+SQLite, nothing special
Hardware: we're rocking ESP-LCD-EV and ESP-CAM boards, using PlatformIO with Arduino and FreeRTOS

One awesome feature is that a single host PC can connect to multiple lower-level devices simultaneously. So, you could have a whole bunch of workstations monitored at once.

Now it is mainly developed for Chinese (Simplified), maybe in the future we will consider i18n 🌐

This project is a bit extensive. My mentor created the first version, but now it is almost entirely mine.

## 简体中文版本的介绍

这是一个使用计算机视觉（YOLO）和 LLM 来监测办公室白领工位健康状况的系统。它就像现实世界中的“屏幕使用时间“一样。可以根据工人的工作姿态、活动情况和饮水习惯，提供实时健康状态反馈和建议。

上位机：Vue+FastAPI+SQLite 的前后端软件。
下位机：ESP-LCD-EV 以及 ESP-CAM。采用 PlatfomIO Arduino/FreeRTOS 开发。
一个上位机支持同时连接多个下位机。

这个项目涉及的面很广，最早它由我的老师创建了第一个版本，但现在它可以说几乎完全是我做的了

title: Table Tennis Ranking Web App
description:
Ever realized how little your table tennis players actually play table tennis in normal training? Well isnt that a shame? Especially since you learn alot playing in a competitive setting!

This is a ranking list which aims to encourage competitive play. It achieves this by giving all players a unique ranking starting from 1 and going on. Their goal is to get to the top by the end of the season. You can move one ranking up when you challenge a player above you and win against them. The app will provide a viewing/player mode and a trainer moder, in which active matches will be started and configured. The viewing mode will also feature stats of the players to encourage improvement.

It is based on flask and bootstrap.

When the project is finished I want this to be an accesible tool which everyone can use if they can host it themselves.

#AI helped me create this (mainly just the frontend) as I am not a huge fan of developing the front end#

title: DIY Arduino and ESP32 based DJ Controller

DIY DJ Controller based on:
ESP32 SuperMini-C3 - Sending info to CYD
CYD (esp32 board with screen) - Displaying tracks information
Arduino Mega - potentiometers and buttons input
Arduino Leonardo - Midi output to pc and potentiometers input

All DJ Controllers are expensive and there's no project that have screen from what iv'e noticed so i decided to make my own.

It's supposed to be usingn python to grab track information and waveform from screen (currently working on making it work for Mixxx)
Uses CYD as display for waveform and track info
Potentiometers and buttons are used for most inputs, 2 magnetic encoders AS5600 are going to be used to jog wheels

Using AI for some help with MIDI outputs (never done it before with arduino, i mess up some stuff and ai messes up some stuff so its 50/50)

title: Radian OS
description:
RadianOS is not a traditional OS or a Linux distribution. It is a modular, architecture-agnostic operating system foundation and toolkit. This document outlines the requirements and design rules for a system to be considered Radian-compliant.

What Makes a System "Radian?"
A Radian system is an OS that conforms to a shared API, structure, and philosophy—allowing different systems to interoperate, share drivers, and be built using the oskit toolkit.

Radian promotes flexibility in implementation, while enforcing a consistent external contract.

She’s not just an assistant, she’s a presence — one that makes learning feel a little less lonely and a lot more human.

This isn’t about replacing effort, it’s about transforming how we approach it. With a warm personality and an intuitive interface, Remi aims to create a space that feels alive, personal, and motivating. She blends functionality with feeling, bringing together the logic of productivity and the soul of friendship.

Remi was made to be remembered — not just as a tool, but as a companion in your daily life. Her purpose is simple: to be there for you, guide you, and grow beside you. Whether you're focused or falling behind, she stays — and that kind of loyalty is rare.

title: Trust Vendor
description:
TrustVendor is a hyperlocal fast-delivery platform that empowers small neighborhood stores to compete with large quick-commerce services like Swiggy Instamart, Zepto, and Blinkit. Unlike those platforms, which rely on centralized warehouses and exclude local shopkeepers, TrustVendor operates without godowns. Instead, it provides a digital storefront to any local vendor, enabling them to sell their products online and fulfill orders within 10–30 minutes in their area.

The platform allows customers to browse items from nearby stores, place orders, and receive fast delivery — all while supporting local businesses. Vendors can sign up easily, manage inventory, and handle orders through a simple interface without any technical expertise. Payments are processed securely through UPI and cards, and deliveries are managed via store-based coordination or local delivery partners.

This project is my attempt to democratize access to quick-commerce infrastructure by giving real-world stores the same digital capabilities as corporate chains — without needing to own a warehouse or a private delivery fleet. TrustVendor aims to make local commerce more competitive, efficient, and sustainable by using technology to level the playing field.

Finura runs directly on the customer’s own company server, ensuring full data ownership and independence. We do not track, analyze, or collect any user data — and we never will. Your business stays your business. From invoicing and inventory management to tax settings and reporting, Finura includes everything you need in one efficient, scalable platform.

Powered by technologies like Redis, Apache Kafka, and more, Finura delivers fast performance, real-time feedback, and the flexibility to grow with your business.

title: eScive
description:
eScive is a mobile app that aims to be a third-party client for e-scooters with Bluetooth functionality, allowing an alternative interface with more features, and more importantly, without all the telemetry that is included in some official apps (generally Chinese ones 👀).
For now, the project specifically targets iScooter "i10" electric scooters, but is coded in a way that will allow other brands in the future.
Communications between devices are based on reverse engineering of packets sent using the BLE protocols, and directly from the decompiled source code of official apps.
The app is made using Flutter and will be published to stores at the end of the project.

title: Space Dodge
description:
Space Dodge is a fast-paced 2D shooting game built using Python and Pygame. The player controls a spaceship that must survive waves of falling meteors and guided rockets while shooting bullets to destroy obstacles. The game features dynamic difficulty, evolving bullet types, sound effects, and custom-designed sprites.

 Features:

Player Movement: Left and right arrow keys control a spaceship character.

Shooting Mechanics: Pressing the Space key fires bullets that vary in size, color, and damage based on score progression.
Falling Meteors: Multiple meteor types fall from random positions with increasing health and speed over time.
Guided Rockets: After a certain score, rockets start chasing the player, adding more challenge.
Sound Effects: A shooting sound plays when the player fires (with plans to toggle it via settings).
Collision Detection: Meteors and rockets damage the player, while bullets reduce enemy health.
Score System: Hitting and destroying meteors increases the player’s score.

Menu System (In Progress): The game starts with a menu including “Play” and “Options” (to toggle sound), high score, and exit.

Special Meteors (Planned): Some meteors will boost the player's life instead of harming them.

Pause/Resume functionality with the ESC key.
Game over play again instead of closeing. 
Choose sound or not and control the volume of sound
Health bar and multiple lives system.
make a rocket lose 2 lifes
Health System (Planned): The player has multiple lives and gets a game over after losing them all.
Animation effects on shooting and collisions.

title: suliman Store
description:
Suliman Store — Redefining Luxury Modest Fashion Online
Suliman Store is a premium, fully responsive e-commerce website dedicated to showcasing modern abayas and sophisticated modest fashion. Designed to provide a seamless and elegant shopping experience, the platform merges advanced web design with cultural authenticity.

The website features a refined, user-centered interface with smooth animations, an intuitive shopping cart system, and a fully custom design system tailored to the brand’s identity. Every detail — from the minimalist color palette to carefully selected typography — reflects a sense of luxury, confidence, and modern style.

Suliman Store is built using only HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, demonstrating how cutting-edge, professional-grade e-commerce solutions can be created without relying on complex frameworks. The site is fully mobile-friendly, supports Arabic right-to-left layouts, and delivers a premium browsing experience across all devices.

Through Suliman Store, the aim is to celebrate tradition while embracing contemporary digital design — empowering women to express their elegance and individuality online.

Suliman Store isn’t just an online shop; it’s a modern digital showcase of culture, craftsmanship, and high-end fashion.

title: Slack-Course
description:
Authentication
Registration: Users can create a new account by providing basic information.

Email Verification: After registering, users must confirm their email address to activate their account.

Login: Registered users can log into their accounts using their credentials.

Forgot Password: If a user forgets their password, they can request a password reset via email.

Moderation
Course Creation / Deletion / Editing: Moderators can create, delete, and modify courses.

Post Management: Moderators can write and edit posts related to the course.

Review Approval: Moderators can approve course applications submitted by users (this acts as course enrollment).

Course Code Generation: Moderators can generate unique codes that allow users to join courses.

Member Management: Moderators can promote, demote, or remove members from a course.

Members
Course Application: Users can apply to join a course, which requires approval.

Leave Course: Users can leave a course they are enrolled in.

Join with Code: Users can instantly join a course by entering a valid course code.

Settings
Change Password: Users can update their account password.

Change Email: Users can modify their registered email address.

Change Username: Users can update their display name or username.

title: BKFZ SubGHz
description:
Welcome! My project is called BKFZ SubGHz (stands for Brian's Knockoff Flipper Zero, lol), a custom-built ESP32 device that can scan, record, and replay SubGHz radio signals, kind of like a DIY version of the Flipper Zero!
I built this last October after getting curious about how the Flipper Zero works, and wanted to recreate part of its functionality using cheap AliExpress parts. What started as a small side project I worked on when I was free quickly turned into one of the most challenging projects I’ve ever made.
The project is powered by an ESP32 (a Wi-Fi microcontroller that runs all the code) which serves a web interface you can access from your phone. The microcontroller is connected to a CC1101 transceiver, which is a chip capable of capturing and replaying SubGHz frequencies like 433 MHz (the Flipper Zero uses this exact same chip from Texas Instruments).
The entire thing is held together by a custom PCB designed in KiCad to keep it small, and it has added support for .sub files from real Flipper Zeros (so it’s compatible with public files from the flipper community). I also added support for preset modulation to match the Flipper Zero's configuration!
Features: - Frequency Analyzer: Scan and analyze nearby devices and their frequencies with ease. - Record RAW: Capture and record nearby signals with precise RSSI configuration. - Replay RAW: Replay previously captured signals from a file (no SD card required). - Preset Configuration: Configure the frequency of your device, and set the preset modulation (just like the Flipper Zero!). - Flipper Zero Support: Effortlessly replay any Flipper Zero SUB file, including the many publicly available ones, whenever you need.

The following parts were used for the project (~$18.01 total, but you can make a minimal USB-powered one for ~$4.98)

Designed for sim pilots who want a smoother, more immersive cockpit experience — no more tabbing out mid-flight.

- Log Every Flight with Ease

Create and manage personalized flight logs to track your virtual aviation journey.

- Custom Aircraft Checklists

Build and interact with detailed checklists for any aircraft. Stay on top of procedures and never miss a step.

- Beautiful, Functional UI

A distraction-free interface optimized for focus and usability — even during complex sim sessions.

- Quick Unit Conversions

Instantly convert between key aviation units (altitude, speed, distance, and more).

Whether you're flying general aviation in X-Plane or running a complex airliner sim in Microsoft Flight Simulator, FlyRight keeps your workflow fast and fluid — completely free.

title: YouTube Screenshot Helper Extension
description:
YouTube Screenshot Helper Extension lets you capture clean, high-quality screenshots from YouTube and other video sites with one click. It automatically hides video controls for clutter-free images and lets you organize screenshots into folders and filenames based on channel, title, date, and more. Perfect for easy, organized video snapshots!
🎯 Core Functionality
🚀 One-Click Screenshots: Capture high-quality video frames instantly
🎮 Smart Control Hiding: Automatically hide video controls for clean screenshots
⌨️ Keyboard Shortcuts: Customizable hotkeys (Ctrl+Shift+S or Shift+Enter in fullscreen)
🎨 Annotation Mode: Add annotations and highlights to your screenshots
📱 Multi-Platform Support: Works on YouTube, Vimeo, Twitch, and custom video sites
🎛️ Advanced Settings
🔧 Flexible Configuration: Fullscreen-only mode, auto-hide controls, custom shortcuts
📁 Smart File Organization: Automatic folder structure with customizable patterns
🏷️ Dynamic Filename Generation: Include video title, channel, timestamp, and date
☁️ Cloud Integration: Upload directly to Google Drive (configurable)
🌙 Theme Support: Auto, light, or dark mode
📏 Quality Control: Adjustable screenshot quality and capture delay

📁 File Organization
Custom download paths
Folder organization patterns:
{channel}/{date} - Group by channel and date
{site}/{title} - Group by site and video title
Custom patterns supported

🏷️ Filename Templates Build filenames with multiple components:
✅ Site name (YouTube, Vimeo, etc.)
✅ Video title
✅ Channel/uploader name
✅ Playlist name
✅ Chapter information
✅ Timestamp
✅ Date and time
🔧 Custom separators

**That's it!** Your app is now available at http://localhost:8501 and will:
- ✅ Start automatically on system boot

- ✅ Provide enterprise-grade reliability

- Complete auto-startup system with macOS LaunchAgent
- Professional process management scripts
- Enhanced rate limiting with intelligent retry logic
- Comprehensive status monitoring and logging
- Production-ready error handling and recovery

### 🔧 **Enhanced Components**
- Bulletproof vectorstore loading with exponential backoff
- Improved upload UI with progress indicators

- ✅ **Long-term Operation**: Designed for continuous use

title: N-gram Models (simple trained AIs)

Although they don't "think" for themselves, they serve as tools for finding relationships in the words we use in our daily life. I have decided to work on these simple machine learning models in order to learn more about them and the other tools I use.

title: Zero-dependency Algebra Calculator
description:
There were two things that I wanted to learn throughout the summer: how computers do math and how to work with microcontrollers at the register level. My thoughts were to make a library for computer algebra in C, with the challenge of no standard library, and stick it onto a PCB with some buttons. How hard can it be?
First, I'm planning on making a library that I can ideally stick a math equation into, then it pops out a solution.
Next, I'll make the hardware for my handheld creation.
Finally, I'll write some embedded software to bridge the physical input with my library.
We'll see where this goes!

title: Pass-the-project: Slack-based community game
description:
Pass-the-project is a collaborative coding project taking place in the Hack Club slack. I'm working on a bot that will help facilitate the game. The rules are as follows:
    1. People vote on a project and tools
    2. The project is hosted on a private GitHub repository
    3. One person has up to a week to work on the project
    4. Once the person pushes to the repo, they lose edit access but can still view, create issues, etc
    5. That person then passes the project onto another person who will be added to the repo
    Repeat until the project is shipped!
