title: Python QOI implementation
description:
The "Quite OK Image Format" (https://qoiformat.org/) is a lossless image compression format that compresses images to a similar size of PNG, while offering 20x-50x faster encoding and 3x-4x speedier decoding.

I heard about it in a video talking about how PNGs work (https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=EFUYNoFRHQI) and found it interesting and it's specification fits on one A4 page, so I decided to implement my version of it in Rust (learning Rust the process) and creating Python bindings for it as python is my primary programming language. This will be a challenge, but I am down for it (-:

In the process of doing so, I saw that to implement this in Rust, I should first understand the algorithm thoroughly, and not tackle two challenges at the same time... For that reason, I am first implementing the entire functionality in Python before porting that code to Rust.

description:
An easy-to-use navigation solution. Written in Next.js (open-source frontend) and Go (closed-source backend), ported to Android and iOS using Capacitor.
This is a mobile cycling navigation app with special route planning optimised for two wheels.
Planned features:
- Navigation
- Group rides: users can sign up for a group ride and see the position of other participants on the map while navigating, allowing everyone to take precautions.
- Community features: users can share their routes and take pictures along the way.

The front end is being built using Next.js and Capacitor with Ionic and Konsta UI. The map will be built using the MapTiler SDK. The tiles come from OpenMapTiles.
The API backend will be written in Go using Fiber as the server.

I use AI to search for and fix bugs and errors.

title: Remote Workflow
description:
In my daily development work, I often run into limitations when working solely on Windows, while wanting the speed and flexibility of a lightweight Linux environment. That’s why I created Remote Workflow.

Remote Workflow lets you easily connect your Linux machine to your Windows system and build fully customized workflows. Whether you’re compiling code on Linux, automating server updates, or performing maintenance tasks — everything stays in sync thanks to efficient and secure file sharing. No more manual copying of files.

The tool features:
- A clean and user-friendly graphical interface on Windows
- Powerful command-line tools
- Excellent documentation to help you get started quickly
- High customizability so you can tailor workflows to your exact needs

Whether you're a beginner or an experienced developer, Remote Workflow makes cross-platform development smooth, fast, and accessible.

title: Fooda
description:
🌟 What is Fooda?
Fooda is a free, AI-powered website created by young innovator Vrishank Joshi (me :)) that helps people make smarter food choices. It scans food and gives it a smart, simple score called the “Vish Score.”

Unlike other apps that only count calories or list nutrition facts, Fooda looks at three things together:

Taste — How delicious the food is.

Nutrition — How healthy it is for your body.

User Opinions — What people think after trying it.

By combining all of this, Fooda gives one powerful score to help people know if a food is truly good — not just healthy, but tasty and trusted by others too.

It’s completely free, built with love and learning, and designed to help people eat better, feel better, and share better food with the world. And best of all, it’s built by an 8-year-old who believes technology should help people — not just make money.

description:
**Bug Dungeon — A Cryptic Coding Adventure**
  Dive into Bug Dungeon, a unique Python puzzle RPG where your coding skills are your weapon! Navigate through a mysterious dungeon filled with cryptographic puzzles and lurking monsters that grow stronger with each bug you leave behind.

**Features**
  Interactive Coding Gameplay: Solve puzzles by writing and debugging simple Python code to unlock secrets and advance.

  Dynamic Monster Threat: Every failed attempt to debug your code causes a menacing gremlin to grow, adding pressure to your progress.

  Immersive Dungeon Map: Explore a grid of cryptic rooms — each with unique challenges — unlocked as you conquer monsters and find hidden loot.

  Intuitive Controls: Use keyboard arrows or mouse clicks to navigate the dungeon and select your next challenge.

  In-Game Cheat Sheet: Access handy hints and coding tips anytime to guide your journey.

  Engaging Story & Rules Screen: Dive into the lore and understand your quest before entering the dungeon.

**If you want to try my game**, just bownload the zip, extract and in the folder open a terminal, and type:
    **python bug_dungeon/game.py**


**Why Bug Dungeon?**
  This project combines classic dungeon crawler vibes with real coding puzzles — perfect for programmers who love games and gamers who want to sharpen their Python skills. It’s designed to be approachable but clever, blending logic, cryptography, and a bit of monster mayhem.

**Music by: Sipgeraf
Creator:Torok Marton aka LizardFolk**

title: PrimeVector - new fast algorithm for GCD and LCM
description:
I’m building a high-performance arithmetic system in Rust that rethinks number representation. By encoding integers as prime exponent vectors, it converts:
Multiplication → Vector addition
GCD/LCM → Min/Max operations
Matrix math → Optimized vector transforms
The core innovation exploits prime factorization’s mathematical properties. Modern hardware outperforms this approach for general cases of multiplication due to extreme optimization of traditional arithmetic. The key bottleneck is factorization latency (why RSA works). Today, it’s not viable for multiplication, but one can easily figure out the most efficient cases for it and combine the binary GCD algorithm with the PFS (Prime Factor System) algorithm and then we get an optimized version of the binary GCD and LCM algorithms (the second one is heavily based on GCD).
Future quantum integration could revolutionize multiplication too:
Shor’s algorithm would enable efficient factorization
Practical for huge numbers (n > 2^25 bits based on my calculations)
Turns prime vectors into an universal accelerator for many operations

title: Tortoiseshell — Tabbycat/Calico Tab Tools
description:
Ever heard of Tabbycat? (https://github.com/TabbycatDebate). In the world of competitive debating (particularly British Parliamentary or World Schools format), Tabbycat is the gold-standard, globally-used software platform for running and recording the results of tournaments.

Tabbycat has some great integrated statistical features (like displaying the "balance"/one-sidedness of topics based on debate results), but also supports an API so geeks like me can manipulate and aggregate data to our hearts content — and that's exactly what I've done with Tortoiseshell.

Just like Tabbycat hosts debate tabs, Tortoiseshell (a different coat pattern :) is a shell for users to interact with raw tab data from the Tabbycat API. Built with Python and Flask, Tortoiseshell allows debaters to unlock deeper statistical insights from tournaments (like motion balance specifically for rooms above a certain skill percentile, judge score averages, and side/position frequency among breaking teams) and track their performance across tournaments, analyzing long-term patterns and trends.

Local-FTP is simple to set up, ideal for LAN environments, perfect for classrooms or quick local transfers without external dependencies. The server is also ideal to be run constantly on a machine since the process is very lightweight.

It doesn't generate any images or anything like that either. So anyway, it allows you to open a lock by showing your hands like this 👍 👎 ✌️ or like this ✊ 👍 ✌️, you enter a password with your hands (literally) and a thing opens! 🎧 Project: Spotify Clone – Because the World Needs More Play Buttons

Ever stared into the digital abyss and thought, “What if I could reinvent the wheel... but it only plays Doja Cat?” Welcome to the Spotify clone experience, where you spend three days obsessing over perfect pixel alignment and three weeks debugging why your songs refuse to play on Safari.

The homepage looks like Spotify’s cooler, broke cousin—minimalist but with dreams.

The play button works! Sometimes. If you ask nicely.

Search functionality proudly returns either 0 results or every MP3 on your laptop, no in-between.

The volume slider lets you feel powerful, though it’s mostly decorative.

And yes, the dark theme is there—because nothing says “music app” like absolute blackness and neon green text.

title: Game 2048
description:
You use the arrow keys on your keyboard:
Up (↑)
Down (↓)
Left (←)
Right (→)
Every time you move, all tiles slide in that direction.
When two tiles with the same number touch, they combine into one tile.
Example: 2 + 2 = 4, 4 + 4 = 8, and so on.
The game ends when:
You reach the 2048 tile 🎉 — You win!
There are no more moves left — Game over!

The bombs dropped on a Saturday, or maybe a Sunday, only god knows now.
It took surprisingly little time for a small coven of religious fanatics, whose motives remain lost to history, to hack into the U.S nuclear arsenal and end five millennia of human civilization in a global storm of radioactive fire.
But is this truly the end of history? Of course not.
The few remaining humans, resilient as cockroaches, bode their time and waited decades to come out of their bunkers and retake the world that had once belonged to them.
Still attached to the nations of the past, they will be the ones to see the rise of the empires of the new world. But will they restore the modern golden age? Or repeat the mistakes of their predecessors?

Up to you to choose a nation and decide...

title: FIXAPL
description: FIXAPL is a programming language inspired by APL, re-imagined using fixed-arity functions all the way down. APL is a language which uses special characters as function names and multidimensional arrays as the primary datatype, allowing for very concise and elegant code. Fixed-arity means that contrary to other APL dialects, there are no variadic functions. That seems like it would be a disadvantage, but it actually provides a lot of benefits, aiding readability of the language as well as providing more expressive tacit (point-free) forms of construction.

Ideal for beginners and experienced lifters alike, Workout_Tracker helps you stay accountable and motivated — one workout at a time.

title: Custom Dog Playing Fetch with ML
description:
This project uses a custom YOLOv5 model to track and follow a 3d printed ball to help a dog play fetch using a live camera. The model is trained to find the ball in each video frame and track its movement as it runs to get the ball and comes back. By looking at where the ball is and how big it looks in the video, the system can tell how far the ball is from the dog.

click here to access replit if demo does not work (the demo is just a simple project that shows the basics how the ball is being detected): https://replit.com/@IshaanAhuja-algebros314/BallDetectionDemo#templates/index.html

title: Weather onchain logger
description:
WeatherChain Logger is a hackathon project that brings real-time weather information onto the blockchain. Users can fetch live weather data (temperature, humidity, etc.) for any location via the OpenWeatherMap API and record it on-chain through a Solidity smart contract. This creates an immutable, tamper-proof log of weather data that anyone can verify.

The frontend is built with React – a JavaScript library for building user interfaces – providing an intuitive web app. Under the hood, we use Hardhat (an Ethereum development environment) to compile and deploy the Solidity contract. Users connect with their MetaMask crypto wallet to authenticate and send transactions.

In summary, WeatherChain Logger offers a simple interface to log weather conditions on Ethereum, ensuring data transparency and persistence.

title: quiz website
description: Code Debugging is a browser-based puzzle game 🎲 that transforms learning to code and debug into an engaging, competitive, and community-driven experience. Players tackle coding challenges 🛠️ by identifying and fixing bugs in code snippets across multiple programming languages (Python, JavaScript, Java, C++). With a three-tier difficulty system (Beginner, Intermediate, Expert) 📈, daily challenges 📅, and weekly tournaments 🏆, the game fosters skill development through gamified problem-solving. Built with web technologies 🌐, it’s accessible, scalable, and designed to appeal to learners and coders.

title: GeoPrimes - Geometric Interpretation of Prime Factorization of Numbers
description: This project visualizes natural numbers as geometric figures in a high-dimensional space defined by their prime factor exponents. Each prime number corresponds to an axis arranged radially in a circle, and a number's prime exponents determine its coordinates along these axes. Stacking these polygons vertically represents multiple numbers, creating a 3D prime-factor geometry. This novel visualization aids intuitive understanding of prime factorization structures and explores new geometric insights in number theory. It combines algebraic concepts with interactive 3D graphics for educational and research applications.

title: Cosmic Defender
description:
Built With 🧑‍💻
This game is built entirely with pure JavaScript, HTML5 Canvas, and CSS3, without any outside dependencies or libraries. Every visual, sound, and game mechanic is handled in-house for buttery smooth 60 FPS action and minimal load times.

How to Play 🎮

    Start the game by clicking the “Start Game” button.

    Move your starship with the mouse or touch input — the ship follows your pointer with ease.

    Blast enemies as they descend and dodge incoming enemy fire.

    Collect power-ups to gain Rapid Fire, Shields, Health, or Multipliers — each is active for a limited time.

    Keep your health up and your multiplier climbing to hit new high scores!

Why Cosmic Defender?
This game was designed to evoke the nostalgic intensity of classic arcade shooters like Space Invaders and Galaga, while using modern web technologies for rich visuals, intuitive control schemes, and feature-packed gameplay. Whether you want a quick 2-minute challenge or an extended session going for the top score, Cosmic Defender is tuned for maximum fun!

🎯 Ready to test your reflexes and fight for galactic supremacy? Jump into Cosmic Defender — the battle for the cosmos awaits you! 🌟

Perfect for showcasing educational offerings, team profiles, and promoting online learning in a visually appealing manner.

title: Pokemonguessr
description:
Got that Pokédex memorized? Prove it.
PokémonGuessr, the daily challenge for trainers who think they know it all. Each day, a new mystery Pokémon from the original 151 is chosen. You have 15 tries to guess its name.

This isn't just a simple lookup. With every guess, the board gives you clues. Is the HP higher or lower? Is the type a perfect match, a partial one, or completely off? Green means you're right on the money. Yellow gets you close. Red means you're cold.

You're not just guessing. You're deducing.

By the end, you'll either stand victorious or face the reveal of the one that got away. Sharpen your knowledge, trust your instincts, and see if you have what it takes to be a true Pokémon Master.

title: EcoPantry
description: EcoPantry is a Maven based JavaFX application that aims to help solve the global climate crisis, billions of dollars in food waste, and money waste. EcoPantry allows users to login and scan receipts (w/ Google's Tesseract OCR), as well as auto-add groceries to let them keep track of what they have online. The application’s color-coded expiry date tracking prevents users from throwing food away too early and too late, and the implementation of APIs (TheMealDB) allows EcoPantry to recommend recipes for close-to-expiring foods. Statistics are also automatically generated to notify users on their food wastage, savings, and financial waste/savings. A points system is also built-in, rewarding users for good choices. A SQLite database is used to manage login, groceries, and almost everything pertaining to specific users.

title: Automated Digital Signage System Using Raspberry Pi with Python Scripting
description:
I worked on setting up Raspberry Pi devices to be used for digital signage. This included installing the required software, setting up the display screens, and making sure the content (like images, videos, or web pages) showed correctly on the screens. I used Python to write scripts that helped control what was shown, when it was shown, and also to manage updates automatically.

Along with that, I also worked on automation tasks using both Python and PHP. This involved writing small programs or scripts that did repeated jobs by themselves, like moving files, sending data between systems, or updating information on websites without needing to do it manually each time. These scripts helped save time and reduce errors in regular tasks.

title: Level Up Your Lectures. Ditch the Boring Notes, Get the AI Spark.
description:
We've all been there: trapped in a lecture so boring it feels like time is moving backward, and your notes end up being a messy scribble of words you can't even read later. 
 
What if you could just hit 'record' and get perfect, summarized, and super-smart notes delivered by AI?
 
Meet NoteSpark, your personal AI note-taker! Our project is designed to automatically record those long lectures, listen to every word (so you don't have to), and instantly generate clean, organized, and intelligent notes. It will pick out the key points, define the tough stuff, and give you the ultimate study guide without you having to write a single word.
 
We're kicking things off with Slovak, but our mission is to break down language barriers for students everywhere, with more languages on the way. 
 
This Summer of Making, we're building the ultimate cheat code for school. Stop taking notes and start learning what actually matters.

title: BLT (Bloat Less Tool)
description:
Windows Debloation Tool - Bloat Less Tool
The Windows Debloation Tool - Bloat Less Tool is a powerful, easy-to-use utility designed to help you streamline and optimize your Windows operating system by removing unnecessary pre-installed apps, services, and background processes. With this tool, you can take full control over your Windows environment, significantly reducing system bloat, improving performance, and enhancing privacy.

Modern Windows installations often come packed with a variety of apps and features that many users neither need nor want. These unwanted programs and processes consume valuable system resources, slow down boot times, and can even compromise user privacy. The Bloat Less Tool provides a simple yet effective solution to regain control of your PC, making your Windows experience lighter, faster, and more efficient.

Whether you're a casual user who wants a clean and clutter-free desktop, a gamer looking to squeeze out every bit of performance, or an IT professional deploying optimized systems for clients or businesses, this tool offers the flexibility and power you need.

Key Features:
✅ Remove Pre-installed Bloatware
Easily uninstall unnecessary apps and programs that come bundled with Windows.

✅ Disable Unwanted Background Services
Turn off background services that slow down your system and reduce performance.

✅ Improve System Performance
Free up system resources, reduce CPU and RAM usage, and speed up your PC.

✅ Enhance Privacy
Disable telemetry, tracking, and other data collection features to protect your privacy.

✅ Customizable and Safe
Choose exactly what you want to remove or disable—no forced actions. Safe, reversible changes.

✅ User-Friendly Interface
Intuitive, clean interface suitable for be

title: Converter (Computer Number system and Morse) Version 2 (GUI Enabled)
description:
This program is a GUI (Graphical Version) and the main aim of this Program is to convert One Computer Number System (Binary, Octal, Hexadecimal and Decimal) to Other or to Encode or Decode URL or Morse. This program is written in Python3 language. 
.
GUI Makes it more easy to use the program.
.
There are 12 Modes in the Program, which are :
    - Decimal to Binary : 123 --> 1111011
    - Decimal to Octal : 123 --> 173
    - Decimal to HexaDecimal : 123 --> 7B
    - Decimal to ASCII : 67 97 99 --> A a c
    - Binary to Decimal : 1111011 --> 123
    - Octal to Decimal : 173 --> 123
    - HexaDecimal to Decimal : 7B --> 123
    - ASCII to Decimal : A a c --> 67 97 99
    - Morse Encode : Awesome --> 01 011 0 000 111 11 0
    - Morse Decode : 01 011 0 000 111 11 0 --> awesome
    - URL Encode : https://github.com/project=converterv2 --> https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fproject%3Dconverterv2%0A
    - URL Decode : https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fproject%3Dconverterv2%0A --> https://github.com/project=converterv2
.
Read More : https://github.com/Hk-Hacker-Harsh/Converter_v2

title: Local SysPilot
description:
📄 Project Description


Local SysPilot is a cross-platform, local-network-based system control dashboard.

Its core goal is to allow users to remotely manage their own computers (Linux) within a local network or VPN—not through the public internet.

Through a secure web interface, you can perform actions like shutting down, locking, or controlling media playback on your device from another trusted device on the same network.

The backend is built for each platform:

    🐧 On Linux, it uses Python and Flask for easy scripting and control.

🔧 Core Features

    Secure login with a lightweight web-based control panel

    System actions: shutdown, lock, sleep, media control

    Runs locally or over VPN, not exposed to the public web

    Modular backend for easy extension (e.g., custom commands)

    Future support for viewing basic system metrics (CPU/RAM, uptime)

title: Weather-onchain logger
description:
WeatherChain Logger is a hackathon project that brings real-time weather information onto the blockchain. Users can fetch live weather data (temperature, humidity, etc.) for any location via the OpenWeatherMap API and record it on-chain through a Solidity smart contract. This creates an immutable, tamper-proof log of weather data that anyone can verify.

The frontend is built with React – a JavaScript library for building user interfaces – providing an intuitive web app. Under the hood, we use Hardhat (an Ethereum development environment) to compile and deploy the Solidity contract. Users connect with their MetaMask crypto wallet to authenticate and send transactions.

In summary, WeatherChain Logger offers a simple interface to log weather conditions on Ethereum, ensuring data transparency and persistence.

title: Citysync
description:
Citysync is a community-powered platform that enables citizens to report local civic issues, participate in charity and community events, and contribute to building smarter, more sustainable cities. It connects individuals, governments, and organizations to take collective action and rewards them for their impact.

Demo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HTcYBYqZrYA

📱 Key Features:
🔧 Civic Issue Reporting
Citizens can report issues with a photo, description, and location.
AI classifies and tags issue type and urgency (using image and text analysis).
Similar issues are merged automatically.
Others can upvote issues, helping the government identify what matters most.

📊 Government Dashboard
Displays all reported issues, sorted by votes, urgency, and location.
Enables status updates (e.g., Received → In Progress → Resolved).
Helps city officials take data-driven decisions and allocate resources smartly.

🤝 Community Action Hub
Citizens can post or join events like beach cleanups, protests, blood donation drives, or workshops.
Users can track impact, get badges, and log their contributions (gamified civic participation).
NGOs and local organizations can recruit volunteers directly from the app.

🪙 Reward System – "Deeds"
Users earn Deeds (points) for contributing to society via:
Reporting civic issues
Joining cleanups or charity events
Volunteering with NGOs
Completing community service challenges

title: MinangScript - Minang Kabau programming Language
description:
🏔️ MinangScript - Modern Programming Language with Minangkabau Philosophy
MinangScript is a revolutionary programming language that brings the wisdom of Minangkabau culture to modern software development. Built on the philosophy of "Alam Takambang Jadi Guru" (Nature unfolds to become our teacher), this language combines intuitive syntax with powerful features for both beginners and experienced developers.

🌟 Key Features
🎯 Intuitive Syntax
Write code that reads like natural language using Minangkabau-inspired keywords:

buek for variables (let/var)
karojo for functions
cetak for output
kalau/lain for conditionals
kumpulan for arrays
benda for objects
🚀 Modern Programming Capabilities
Native Data Structures: Built-in arrays (kumpulan) and objects (benda)
Web Development Ready: DOM manipulation and HTTP/API support
Algorithm Implementation: Perfect for LeetCode and competitive programming
Cross-Platform: Runs on Windows, macOS, and Linux
🌐 Web Development Support
Interactive web compiler with real-time transpilation
DOM manipulation with Minangkabau keywords
HTTP request handling with native functions
Complete web application templates
📊 Educational Focus
Comprehensive syntax reference with examples
Interactive code editor with instant feedback
Algorithm visualization and learning tools
Bilingual documentation for global accessibility
🎨 Web Compiler Features
The MinangScript web compiler provides:

Real-time compilation from MinangScript to JavaScript
Interactive execution with console output display
Comprehensive syntax table with all language constructs
Example code snippets for quick learning
Beautiful glass-morphism UI with responsive design
🏆 Perfect For
Students learning programming fundamentals
Educators teaching algorithmic thinking
Developers exploring cultural programming languages
Web developers building interactive applications
Algorithm enthusiasts practicing problem-solving
🌍 Cultural Impact
MinangScript bridges the gap between traditional Indonesian culture and modern technology, making programming accessible to Indonesian speakers while introducing global developers to the beauty of Minangkabau philosophy. It demonstrates how cultural wisdom can enhance software development practices.

Experience the harmony of tradition and innovation with MinangScript - where nature's wisdom meets modern programming.

title: Noise Reduction Microservice
description:
Provide a stateless, horizontally-scalable service that removes background noise, improves
SNR and speech clarity on single audio chunks (10-60 s WAV) before transcription. The
service keeps the same invocation pattern as the Chunking Microservice, but gains:
• an adaptive decision engine that picks either an ML pipeline (Demucs-v4) or an
efficient FFmpeg filter chain based on measured SNR (< 20 dB → ML, ≥ 20 dB →
FFmpeg), and
• richer quality-metrics JSON returned with every job and published in the
audio.cleaned CloudEvent

title: Whatsapp Chat Analyzer
description:
# WhatsApp Chat Analyzer

A Python tool for analyzing WhatsApp chat exports, providing detailed statistics, word frequency analysis, and visualizations.

## Features

- **Message Statistics**: Total messages, words, and activity patterns
- **Word Frequency Analysis**: Most commonly used words overall and per person
- **Per-Person Analytics**: Individual chat statistics and usage patterns
- **Temporal Analysis**: Monthly breakdowns and hourly activity patterns
- **Data Visualizations**: Charts and word clouds
- **Comprehensive Reports**: Detailed text output with all analysis results

title: ScanBridge
description:
ScanBridge is an open-source Android app for taking advantage of document and photo scanners supporting the eSCL/AirScan protocol (which are most modern scanners). It is the first open-source Android app that is able to do all of the following:
- Discover supported scanners in the local network
- Scan multiple pages
- Export as PDF or images
- Make full use of the scanner settings
- Nice Material You UI and good UX

This makes it incredibly useful for anyone having to scan and send documents frequently. I use the app regularly to archive documents, scan sheet music or to scan and send written notes from my school classes to friends.

Core Features:
- Account creation with OAuth
- Legislation topic tracking and bookmarking

- Post questions, bug reports, and express your thoughts on particular legislation
- High level views of legislation activity throught the U.S.

title: Oscilloscope Online V2
description:
Research Work? Robotics? Monitoring Systems? Electrical Engineering? Meet Oscilloscope Online, the one stop data visualization web app. I made this so that students can use a 3$ Arduino instead of a 500$ Oscilloscope when they were working with electrical circuits, but one way or another it has become an interface for data loggers. Just grab an MCU, code it to get whatever data you want and plug it in!

There's a vast variety of features including .csv export/import; png export; custom timescale; logarithmic y scale; special mcu commands to automate the process and much more! Plot any number of graphs and use whatever colors you like. Customize the input format to adapt it to your own code. (Don't replace your commas with slashes because someone said so!!)

Additionally Oscilloscope Online also handles null values better to ensure the plotting never stops!!
The graph isn't just a picture either! You can zoom in and out as well as see what value your mouse is hovering over. IT'S COMPLETELY INTERACTIVE!!!

title: Typr.
description:
typr is a clean, minimalist, and modern typing game designed to help you improve your typing speed and accuracy. Built with Vue.js and Vite, it offers a fast, responsive, and seamless user experience. The interface is designed to be distraction-free, allowing you to focus solely on your typing.

Key Features:

WPM and Accuracy Tracking: Get real-time feedback on your Words Per Minute (WPM) and accuracy percentage at the end of each round.

title: Bitwarden Auto-Backup Manager
description:
Welcome! My project features Bitwarden Auto-Backup Manager, a user-friendly application that creates local, encrypted auto-backups for your Bitwarden vault (without your master password).
For the longest time now, Bitwarden (the password manager) has refused to implement backup functionality into their applications, more specifically the cloud-hosted solution. This left us users without an easy way to securely back up our vault data in the event of a server shutdown or other emergency. This Electronjs-based application fixes this very problem by providing reliable, automatic backups you control.
The best part? Bitwarden Auto-Backup Manager is powered by the official Bitwarden clients library (found on GitHub) for backup file generation, as well as CryptoJS for PBKDF2 encryption/decryption methods, allowing you to decrypt your backups at any time! Your vault is synced with the help of the Bitwarden Desktop app (for credentials) and the Bitwarden API.
I built this application back in July of 2024, but I noticed that it lacks many expected features and nice-to-haves. Also, the code could definitely be much improved, which is why I decided to revamp this project during this Summer!

title: DITMail — Secure, Scalable, Developer-First Mail Infrastructure
description:
DITMail is a next-generation mail server platform built for modern developers, startups, and enterprises who need full control over sending and receiving email—whether for personal inboxes, businesses, or temporary email use cases.

Powered by Haraka, enhanced with DKIM/TLS security, and designed for Dockerized scalability, DITMail offers a flexible email ecosystem that supports:

🌐 Custom domain hosting

🔐 End-to-end authenticated SMTP

📥 Catch-all or per-user inbox routing

🧩 Modular plugin system for anti-spam, DKIM, queueing, and user validation

⚙️ Built-in DKIM key generator and TLS provisioning

🚀 Webmail-ready architecture with IMAP extensibility (via Dovecot)

🧪 Developer-friendly APIs and logs for integration and testing

DITMail supports both temporary email applications (like public inboxes or disposable addresses) and professional-grade email services (with authentication, Maildir inboxing, and domain-based identity).

Whether you're building:

A temp mail site like freecustom.email

A Zoho Mail-like pro SaaS for clients with custom domains

Or your own personal mail server with full transparency and control

…DITMail is your all-in-one, open, and modular email infrastructure toolkit.

title: Timer Bot
description:
Welcome! My project features a bot for Discord communities to create detailed timers, alarms, and reminders in their Discord server. This project is very special to me because it was actually my very first coding project back in 2020! A project so small also happened to be the project that helped me discover my true passion for coding, and helped me start my journey with Node.js development. For years now, Discord has lacked a native way to create timers, alarms, and reminders in Discord servers (a rather simple feature that many large communities have asked for). This bot is my attempt to finally solve that problem once and for all!
I started developing this bot back in middle school, but over time, it became too overwhelming with the constant changes to Discord's API. With factors outside of my reach like rising server costs and busy study nights throughout the week, I eventually decided to shut down the project. Well, my goal this week is to try and bring it back to life, and rebuild the entire thing from the ground up!
I'll be honest, being my first ever coding project, Timer Bot was definitely the sloppiest code I've ever written (nowhere near being production-ready). So I figured why not spend this Summer rewriting the entire thing from scratch. I recently picked up some new equipment to help keep my personal projects running (like websites and Immich servers), so this is my attempt of reviving it and giving it another life :)
Features: - (⏱️) Create precise timer countdowns with hours, minutes, and seconds. - (⏰) Schedule alerts for specific dates and times in your local time zone. - (📝) Add titles and descriptions to your alarms to be notified of your upcoming events, goals, and more! - (💾) Save timer configurations with custom names for quick access anytime. - (📋) Manage all your running timers, alarms, and reminders in one place. - (🌐) Set your local time zone for accurate alarm scheduling. - (🔔) Choose users or roles to notify when an event ends.

title: cityBike
description:
The CityBike project is a management system for bike rentals in a city. It allows for loading customer and bike information from files, simulating reservations for electric and mechanical bikes, and calculating the costs associated with each customer. Customers can make reservations for mechanical bikes, which have no cost, or electric bikes, which have a base cost with discounts depending on their type (YOUNG or SENIOR). The system simulates 100 reservations for each day in June 2025, randomly assigning bikes to customers. At the end, the system calculates the total cost of each customer's reservations and determines who has the highest accumulated cost.

The code is structured into several classes, such as CityBike, Cliente, Bicicleta, Estacion, and Reserva, with key methods that allow loading data from binary and CSV files, simulating reservations, and calculating the associated costs. The system also handles possible errors in input data and ensures that bikes and stations are managed correctly. Information about customers, reservations, and costs is presented clearly and concisely, and the customer with the highest cost is easily identified, providing a clear view of the system's usage and costs.

I programmed this in Spanish because it is my native language and the one I feel most comfortable with.

description:

Right now there is only an CLI but a HTMX based GUI will be added soon. 

The PC Driver is written in Go to be as lightweight as possible to not affect performance of for example Virtual DJ Software ore DAWs and to make cross-platform easy. 
Right now I am developing for arch linux (because that's what I use btw) but it *should* be working on any desktop platform (Win, Mac and the beloved penguin one).
The ESP32 Firmware is written in C++ and compiled using the ArduinoIDE to make it easy to flash for anyone.

You are able to select a input type (Rotary, Button, Potentiometer etc.) for each GPIO-Pin on your ESP. This will be saved to flash and work on startup after you configured it.

To be transparent: I use AI to generate Styles for the UI, to generate documentation texts (i am not good at writing stuff), to generate small code portions (copilot auto complete) and to understand error messages better,  but the logic and most of the code are written by me, Jorim.

title: Shake Alert
description:

This repository is a demo web application for real-time earthquake detection and disaster response, leveraging the power of crowdsourced sensor data, mapping, and robust communication features. Key Features
Earthquake Detection via Phone Sensors:
Utilizes the phone's accelerometer to detect significant shaking. When multiple nearby devices register similar patterns, an earthquake is confirmed and real-time alerts are sent out.

Crowd Confirmation:
Earthquake events are validated using data from surrounding users’ devices, ensuring high accuracy and reducing false alarms.

Disaster Heatmap (Snapchat-style):
Users can post photos and videos from affected areas. These are aggregated and displayed as a heatmap on Google Maps, visually representing disaster intensity and scope.

Interactive Map with Profile Markers:

When zoomed in, user locations are shown as their profile pictures on the map.
Hovering or clicking a marker opens a popup with user details (name, status, contact info, etc.).
Marker clustering for low zoom levels, expanding into individual profiles as you zoom closer.
Real-Time Location & Alerts:
The app continuously shares and updates user locations for efficient disaster response and coordination.

Offline Chat & Satellite Connectivity:
Supports offline messaging and satellite communication features (targeted for Android 15), ensuring connectivity even during network outages.

User Authentication:

Handles authentication, real-time data updates, and backend logic.

title: Okta Role Mining with OPA-Driven Access Recommendations
description:
This project automates the process of role mining in Okta by integrating a LangGraph-based agent with GPT-powered group suggestion and Open Policy Agent (OPA) for access validation. The system analyzes user profiles, their current group memberships, and department data to intelligently recommend group assignments. It validates these recommendations against organizational policies enforced by OPA, ensuring compliant and optimized group assignments.

The solution includes:
1. A React-based Frontend for user selection and result visualization.
2. A FastAPI-based Backend to handle agent requests and serve the LangGraph engine.
3. An Okta API Integration Layer for real-time user and group data retrieval.
4. An OPA Policy Evaluation Layer to block non-compliant group assignments.
5. Real-time logs for step-by-step traceability.
This project streamlines identity governance, enhances security posture, and provides an interactive interface for role analysis and decision-making.

Wrapper Layer: Orchestrating the System
The Wrapper Layer acts as the central orchestration engine that connects the frontend, backend, LangGraph agent, Okta APIs, and the OPA policy engine in a seamless flow. It provides a unified API interface that simplifies interactions across these distributed components.

Key functions of the Wrapper Layer:
1. Data Aggregation:
Collects user and group information from the Okta API and serves it in a cleaned, frontend-friendly format.
2. Process Invocation:
Sends user data to the LangGraph agent for group suggestion and orchestrates the complete flow from input selection to final decision.
3. Response Routing:
Handles asynchronous processing and real-time log streaming to the frontend, ensuring users can track every step of the decision process live.
4. Abstraction:
Decouples the complex backend logic from the React frontend, providing clean and minimal APIs for easy consumption.
5. Modular Branches:
Supports independent development and versioning of different components (agent, backend, frontend, OPA) by providing a consistent entry point.

title: Project Sentient
description:
Sentient is an AI-powered command-line assistant designed for cybersecurity, automation, and digital forensics. First of its kind, there are no restrictions to what this AI hybrid can do—it’s built to do it all. Sentient can send traffic and imitate real human traffic, find vulnerabilities in websites and help you fix them, track emails and usernames across platforms, and edit, analyze, and understand files and their contents to ensure safety or improve them. It can copy entire websites to demonstrate phishing attacks, reverse engineer malware and viruses, decrypt and encrypt passwords and keys, and perform Google dorking for advanced search and OSINT.

Sentient now also features PDF and image analysis, password and breach checks, GeoIP and reverse IP lookups, Shodan and VirusTotal integration, username checks, packet capture and analysis, subdomain takeover detection, CVE search, JWT decoding, URL expansion, and file type identification—making it a much more comprehensive cybersecurity assistant. It supports phone number, email, and domain lookups (including WHOIS, DNS, and subdomains), port scanning, directory brute-forcing, SSL/TLS security checks, log file analysis, and exporting detailed reports. Sentient can auto-update itself, generate and analyze hashes, crack passwords, extract and analyze metadata, integrate with threat intelligence feeds, generate custom wordlists, schedule scans, integrate with Slack/Discord/webhooks, scan files with YARA rules, provide AI-powered remediation suggestions, support user-created plugins, and generate detailed PDF/HTML reports.

While Sentient uses the Gemini API as its base for conversational AI, it extends and overlaps this capability by giving the AI direct access to powerful cybersecurity, automation, and OSINT modules—enabling it to not just chat, but to act, analyze, and automate complex security tasks far beyond standard AI assistants. Sentient is your all-in-one AI cybersecurity and automation toolkit—constantly evolving to meet new threats and challenges.

title: Filter
description:
Perhaps the simplest way to represent an image is with a grid of pixels (i.e., dots), each of which can be of a different color. For black-and-white images, we thus need 1 bit per pixel, as 0 could represent black and 1 could represent white.

In this sense, then, is an image just a bitmap (i.e., a map of bits). For more colorful images, you simply need more bits per pixel. A file format (like BMP, JPEG, or PNG) that supports “24-bit color” uses 24 bits per pixel. (BMP actually supports 1-, 4-, 8-, 16-, 24-, and 32-bit color.)

A 24-bit BMP uses 8 bits to signify the amount of red in a pixel’s color, 8 bits to signify the amount of green in a pixel’s color, and 8 bits to signify the amount of blue in a pixel’s color. If you’ve ever heard of RGB color, well, there you have it: red, green, blue.

If the R, G, and B values of some pixel in a BMP are, say, 0xff, 0x00, and 0x00 in hexadecimal, that pixel is purely red, as 0xff (otherwise known as 255 in decimal) implies “a lot of red,” while 0x00 and 0x00 imply “no green” and “no blue,” respectively. In this problem, you’ll manipulate these R, G, and B values of individual pixels, ultimately creating your very own image filters.

In a file called helpers.c in a folder called filter-less, write a program to apply filters to BMPs.

This is a problem from CS50x, Problem Set 4.

title: Anon Board
description:
🧠 Anon Board – Anonymous Emotional Map 🌍💬
Anon Board is a minimalist web platform that lets people around the world share their thoughts and emotions – completely anonymously.
No accounts. No names. No likes. Just raw human feeling, visualized as colors and words.

🎯 Purpose
To show one simple truth:
You are not alone.
Somewhere, someone feels exactly like you – even if you never meet.

🧩 How it works
🟣 Users post a short sentence (max ~100 characters) about how they feel.

🎨 They assign it a color that represents the emotion:

🔵 Blue = sadness

🔴 Red = anger

🟢 Green = hope

🟡 Yellow = joy

⚪ White = emptiness

🟣 Purple = fear

🗺️ All entries appear as colorful dots scattered across a dark, calming board.

🖱️ Hover or tap on any dot to reveal the anonymous message.

➕ Add your own emotion via a simple, safe “Add Emotion” popup.

🌐 Core principles
🕊️ 100% anonymous – no tracking, no accounts

🧘 Emotionally safe – soft visuals, no judgment

📱 Simple & responsive – works on mobile and desktop

💡 No interaction mechanics – no likes, comments or shares

❤️ Community without identity – collective emotional presence

👥 Use cases
Emotional expression without fear

Daily journaling for mental clarity

Public installations (schools, therapy spaces, workshops)

Empathy-building in groups and organizations

✨ Vision
In a world of endless noise and pressure, Anon Board creates a quiet space
to feel, reflect, and realize:
“I’m not the only one.” 🌌

title: AP Study Tool
description: AP Study Tool is exactly as it sounds -- a tool to help each individual succeed on their AP exams! I was inspired to make this project, as this year when I was studying for my exams, I realized there are not many resources available online. All the resources I found were very boring, and I got distracted easily from them because they had a plain white UI. To solve this issue, AP Study Tool uses an aesthetic pink UI theme to ensure that students do not get distracted by a boring old UI when studying for their AP exams. The web app explains big ideas, includes helpful resources, and may even have an AI helper in the future! Although it doesn't have EVERY single AP exam on it, the website offers resources for the most popular AP exams available. Happy studying, and I hope AP Study Tool helps you ✨ slay ✨ your exams!

title: Ultradexbot-Your interactive poke-companion on Discord
description:
UltraDexBot is a Pokédex-themed Discord bot I built during Summer of Making!  
It lets you search for Pokémon by name or number and returns their type, height, weight, description, and even shiny sprites. ✨
Here is the link so anyone can use it and enjoy Ultradex: https://discord.com/oauth2/authorize?client_id=1390090341075652679&permissions=67584&integration_type=0&scope=bot
I´m basically new to this type of coding, but I hope it helps! 
It currently supports commands like:
- !pokemon <name|number> – stats
!info <name|number> – stats + description
!shiny <name|number> – shiny sprite ✨
!evo <name|number> – evolution line 🔁
!random – random Pokémon
!save <name|number> – add to team
!remove <name|number> – remove from team
!team – show your saved Pokémon
!help – this message
I built it using Node.js, Discord.js, and the PokéAPI(https://pokeapi.co/).  
This was my first time working with APIs and building a bot from scratch — and now I can't stop adding features!
My dream is to make UltraDexBot feel like a digital Pokémon partner: interactive, fun, and always ready to help you explore the Pokéverse. Gotta fetch 'em all!
(Also I'm farming shells to earn a Playdate 😅🎮)

Raw Github link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Jaco955/Ultradex-bot/refs/heads/main/README.md
 Github link:https://github.com/Jaco955/Ultradex-bot
Documentation: https://github.com/Jaco955/Ultradex-bot/blob/main/README.md

title: Cancer Screening Test
description:
You’ve heard of medical screening bots — standard agents used by hospitals to turn away unnecessary patients. They're all surface-level. Generic symptom checkers with scripted flows that rarely understand real clinical pathways.

What I built goes deeper.

This is an intelligent oncology triage system designed with clinical logic at its core. Instead of vague symptom matching, it uses structured decision pathways tailored to cancer screening protocols — streamlining the pre-diagnosis process with precision. It doesn’t just save time; it meaningfully reduces the load on oncologists by guiding patients toward the right tests, or away from unnecessary ones, before they ever enter the clinic. The system is built to simulate a structured pre-consultation, mirroring the logic a specialist would follow, but without taking up clinical time.

The AI agent follows a decision-tree logic model designed in alignment with oncology screening guidelines and based on the patient’s responses, it recommends appropriate screening tests (e.g. mammogram, colonoscopy, bloodwork) or flags the case for urgent follow-up.

I'm not just building a prototype or a "student project". I'm developing a solution that is deployable in real-world environments, especially in clinics and hospitals where specialist access is limited.

title: GoalForge
description:
GoalForge - Transform Your Aspirations into Achievements
GoalForge is a sleek, modern goal-tracking web application built with React that helps you capture, organize, and pursue your personal and professional objectives. With its clean, gradient-inspired design and intuitive interface, GoalForge makes goal management both beautiful and effortless.

Key Features
✨ Instant Goal Creation - Add new goals with a simple, elegant input interface
🔄 Persistent Storage - Your goals automatically save to local storage, ensuring they survive browser refreshes
📊 Real-time Stats - Track your total goals, completed items, and work in progress at a glance
🎨 Modern Design - Beautiful gradient backgrounds, smooth animations, and responsive layout
🗑️ Easy Management - Delete goals with a single click when they're no longer needed

Built with React hooks for state management and styled with Tailwind CSS for a polished, professional appearance. Perfect for anyone looking to stay organized and motivated on their path to success!

Start forging your future today - every great achievement begins with a single goal.
